verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:1
verses.text: Nisibene Hymns.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:2
verses.text: Hymn I.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:4
verses.text: O God of mercies Who didst refresh Noah, he too refreshed Thy mercies.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:5
verses.text: He offered sacrifice and stayed the flood; he presented gifts and received the promise.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:6
verses.text: With prayer and incense he propitiated Thee: with an oath and with the bow Thou wast gracious to him; so that if the flood should essay to hurt the earth, the bow should stretch itself over against it, to banish it away and hearten the earth.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:7
verses.text: As Thou hast sworn peace so do Thou maintain it, and let Thy bow strive against Thy wrath!  R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:8
verses.text: Stretch forth Thy bow against the flood, for lo! it has lifted up its waves against our walls!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:9
verses.text: In revelation, Lord! it has been proclaimed, that that lowly blood which Noah sprinkled, wholly restrained Thy wrath for all generations; how much mightier then shall be the blood of Thy Only Begotten, that the sprinkling of it should restrain our flood! For lo! it was but as mysteries of Him that those lowly sacrifices gained virtue, which Noah offered, and stayed by them Thy wrath.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:10
verses.text: Be propitiated by the gift upon my altar, and stay from me the deadly flood.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:11
verses.text: So shall both Thy signs bring deliverance, to me Thy cross and to Noah Thy bow! Thy cross shall cleave the sea of waters; Thy bow shall stay the flood of rain.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:13
verses.text: Lo! all the billows trouble me; and Thou hast given more favour to the ark: for waves alone encompassed it, mounds and weapons and waves encircle me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:14
verses.text: It was unto Thee a storehouse of treasures, but I have been a storehouse of debts: it in Thy love subdued the waves; I in Thy wrath, am left desolate among the weapons; the flood bore it, the river threatens me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:15
verses.text: O Helmsman of that ark, be my pilot on the dry land! To it Thou gavest rest in the haven of a mountain; to me give Thou rest also in the haven of my walls!  4.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:16
verses.text: The Just One has chastened me abundantly, but it He loved even among the waves.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:17
verses.text: For Noah overcame the waves of lust, which had drowned in his generation the sons of Seth.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:18
verses.text: Because his flesh revolted against the daughters of Cain, his chariot rode on the surface of the waves.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:19
verses.text: Because women defiled him not, he coupled the beasts, whereof in the ark he joined together, all pairs in the yoke of wedlock.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:20
verses.text: The olive which with its oil gladdens the face, with its leaf gladdened their countenances: for me the river whereof to drink is wont to make joyful, lo! O Lord, by its flood it makes me mournful.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:22
verses.text: The foulness of my guilt Thy righteousness has seen, and Thy pure eyes abhor me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:23
verses.text: Thou hast gathered the waters by the hand of the unclean, that Thou mightest make for me purification of my guilt; not that in them Thou mightest baptize and purify me, but that in them Thou mightest chasten me with fear.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:24
verses.text: For the waves will stir up to prayer, which shall wash away my guilt.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:25
verses.text: The sight of them which is full of repentance, has been to me a baptism.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:26
verses.text: The sea, O Lord, which should have drowned me, in it let Thy mercies drown my guilt.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:27
verses.text: In the Red Sea Thou didst drown bodies; in this sea drown Thou my guilt instead of bodies!  6.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:28
verses.text: An ark in Thy mercy Thou didst prepare, that Thou mightest preserve in it all the remnants.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:29
verses.text: That Thou shouldest not desolate the earth in Thy wrath, Thy compassion made an earth of wood.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:30
verses.text: Thou didst empty them one into the other; Thou didst render them back one unto the other.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:31
verses.text: But my lands have thrice been filled and emptied again; and now against me the waves rebel, to overwhelm the remnant that has escaped in me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:32
verses.text: In the ark Thou didst save a remnant; save in me, O Lord, yea in me a leaven.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:33
verses.text: The ark upon the mountain brought forth; let me in my lands bring forth my imprisoned ones!  7.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:34
verses.text: O Lord, gladden Thou in me the imprisoned ones of my fortresses, Thou Who didst gladden those prisoners with the olive leaf! Thou sentest healing by means of the dove to the sick ones that were drowning in every wave; it entered in and drove out all their pains.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:35
verses.text: For the joy of it swallowed up their sorrow, and mourning vanished away in its consolation.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:36
verses.text: And as the chief of a host gives heartening to the fugitives, so the dove disseminated courage among the forsaken.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:37
verses.text: Their eyes tasted the sight of peace, and their mouth hasted to open in Thy praise.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:38
verses.text: As the olive leaf in the waves, save Thou me, that Thou mayest gladden in me the prisoners of my fortresses!  8.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:39
verses.text: The flood assails, and dashes against our walls: may the all-sustaining might uphold them! It falls not as the building of the sand, for I have not built my doctrine upon the sand: a rock shall be for me the foundation, for on Thy rock have I built my faith; the secret foundation of my trust, shall support my walls.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:40
verses.text: For the walls of Jericho fell, because on the sand she had built her trust.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:41
verses.text: Moses built a wall in the sea, for on a rock his understanding built it.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:42
verses.text: The foundation of Noah was on a rock; the dwelling place of wood it bore up in the sea.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:44
verses.text: Compare the souls which are in me, with the living things that were in the ark; and instead of Noah who mourned in it, lo! Thy altar mourning and humbled.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:45
verses.text: Instead of the wedded wives that were in it, lo! my virgins that are unmarried.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:46
verses.text: Instead of Ham who went forth from it and uncovered his father's nakedness, lo! workers of righteousness, who have nourished and clothed apostles.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:47
verses.text: In my pains, O my Lord, I rave in my speech; blame me not if my words provoke Thee! Thou puttest to silence the prosperous when they murmured: have mercy on me as on them that were silenced aforetime!  10.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:48
verses.text: Before Thy wrath Thou madest a house of refuge, and all the nations rebelled against it.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:49
verses.text: Noah was refreshed in rest, that his dwelling-place should give rest according to his name.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:50
verses.text: Thou didst close the doors to save the righteous one; Thou didst open the floods to destroy the unclean.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:51
verses.text: Noah stood between the terrible waves that were without, and the destroying mouths that were within: the waves tossed him and the mouths dismayed him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:52
verses.text: Thou madest peace for him with them that were within; Thou broughtest down before him them that were without: Thou didst speedily change his troubles, for light to Thee, O Lord, are hard things.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:54
verses.text: Hear and weigh the comparison of me with Noah, and though my suffering be light beside his, let Thy mercy make our deliverance alike; for lo! my children stand like him, between the wrathful and the destroyer.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 1:55
verses.text: Give peace, O Lord, among them that are within, and humble before me them that are without; and give me twofold victory! And whereas the slayer has made his rage threefold, may He of the three days show me threefold mercy! Let not the Evil One overcome Thy lovingkindness: seeing he has assailed me twice and thrice overcome Thou him! Let my victory fly abroad through the world, that it may earn Thee praise in the world! O Thou who didst rise on the third day, give us not over to death in our third peril!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:1
verses.text: Hymn II.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:3
verses.text: This day are opened, our mouths to give thanks.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:4
verses.text: They who opened the breaches, have opened my sons' mouths.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:5
verses.text: Thank the Merciful, who has delivered the men of our city, nor thought at that time of exacting the debts that were due by us.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:6
verses.text: When they rose up they that took us captive, the worlds in our deliverance, tasted of Thy graciousness.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:7
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:8
verses.text: From all that have mouths, glory be to Thy grace!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:9
verses.text: He has saved us without wall, and taught us that He is our wall: He has saved us without king and made us know that is our king: He has saved us, in each and all, and showed us that He is All: He has saved us in His grace and again reveals, that freely He has mercy and quickens.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:10
verses.text: From every boaster, He takes away his boasting, and gives it to His own grace.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:12
verses.text: The sound of all mouths, is too little for Thy praise: for lo! in the hour when our light was smoking, and was at the point to be quenched (seeing that all is easy to Thee) of a sudden it awoke and shone! Who has seen these two marvels, that for him whose hope was cut off, hope has sprung up and increased; the hour of mourning has been turned into good tidings?  4.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:13
verses.text: This is a festival day, whereon hang the feasts: for if wrath had taken us captive, lo! our feasts too had ceased.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:14
verses.text: Whereas our peace has conquered and triumphed, lo! our festivals resound.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:15
verses.text: This blessed day supports all: upon it depends the city, on the city depends the people, on the people depends peace, on peace depends all.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:17
verses.text: Out of these breaches, Thou hast multiplied triumphs.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:18
verses.text: Praise unto the Triune God goes up from the three breaches; for that He descended and repaired them, in His mercy which restrains wrath.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:19
verses.text: He smote the enemy who understood not that He was teaching us.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:20
verses.text: He taught those within, for in His justice He made the breaches; He taught those without, for in His goodness He repaired them.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:22
verses.text: Speak and give glory, my delivered ones on this day; old men and boys, young men and maidens, children and innocents, and thou, O Church, mother of the city! For the old men have been rescued from captivity, the youths from torture, the sucklings from being dashed in pieces, the women from dishonour, and the Church from mockery.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:24
verses.text: He came to us with hardness; we were afraid for a moment: He came in gentleness, and we rejoiced for an hour.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:25
verses.text: He turned and left us for a little, we wandered without end; like a beast of prey which is trained by blandishments and by fear, but if so be that men turn from it, rebels and strays and becomes savage in the midst of peace.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:27
verses.text: He punished us and we feared not; He rescued us, and we were not shamed: He straitened us and our vows were multiplied; He enlarged us and our crimes were multiplied.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:28
verses.text: When He constrained there was a covenant, when He gave breathing-space there was straying.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:29
verses.text: Though He knew us He lowered Himself to establish us.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:30
verses.text: In the evening we exalted Him; in the morning we rejected Him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:31
verses.text: When necessity left us, faithfulness left us.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:33
verses.text: He afflicted us by the breaches, that He might punish our crimes: He raised the mounds that thereby, He might humble our boasting.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:34
verses.text: He made a breach for the seas that thereby, He might wash away our pollution.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:35
verses.text: He shut us in that we might gather together in His Temple.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:36
verses.text: He shut us in and we were quenched; He set us free and we went astray.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:37
verses.text: We are like unto wool, which passes into every colour.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:39
verses.text: We know that when the blessed sons of Nineveh repented, it was not because of mounds they repented, nor yet by means of waters, nor was it by reason of a breach, nor yet by reason of bows; it was not at the sound of the bowstring they feared and repented.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:40
verses.text: They harkened to a feeble voice; they caused their little ones to fast; they made their youths chaste, they made their kings humble.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:42
verses.text: Thou smotest us and we justified Thee, for it befel not by chance; Thou deliveredst us and we gave thanks, for it was not that we were worthy.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:43
verses.text: Thou hadst mercy on us not because Thou erredst, in hoping that we should repent.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:44
verses.text: It was manifest to Thee that when Thou hadst mercy on us we strayed.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:45
verses.text: Thou knewest that we had sinned; Thou knewest that we are sinners: with our iniquity that has been and is, Thou wast acquainted when Thou hadst mercy on us.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:47
verses.text: Weigh our repentance, that it may outbalance our crimes! But not in even balance, ascends either weight; for our crimes are heavy and manifold, and our repentance is light.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:48
verses.text: He had commanded that we should be sold for our debt: His mercy became our advocate; principal and increase, we repaid with the farthing, which our repentance proffered.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:50
verses.text: Ten thousand talents for that little payment, our debt He forgave us.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:51
verses.text: He was bound to exact it, that He might appease His justice: He was constrained again to forgive, that He might make His grace to rejoice.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:52
verses.text: Our tears for the twinkling of an eye we gave Him; He satisfied His justice, in exacting and taking a little; He made His grace to rejoice, when for a little He forgave much.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:54
verses.text: Ten thousand are the crimes that He has pardoned; ten thousand tongues, are unable to suffice, in presence of His goodness.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:55
verses.text: He has pardoned us and we have not pardoned; we have requited to Him contrariwise; the guilt committed we write up afresh.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:56
verses.text: "Pardon, O Lord," we cry; "Requite, O Lord," we pray: "pardon" verily when we have done wrong; "requite" verily when wrong is done us.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:58
verses.text: Yea not as those without, have we laboured for our lives.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:59
verses.text: They have raised their mounds, but we not even our voices: they have broken through the wall, but we—not even the chains, the frail chains on our heart within have we broken.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:60
verses.text: God has rejected the diligent, for the sake of the slothful; He has rejected the labour done without, though He was rejected from within.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:62
verses.text: He has set free them that talked, and smitten the silent; the wall was beaten, and the people were instructed: He spared them that can suffer, He smote that which knows no suffering.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:63
verses.text: For instead of souls that feel, He smote the stones that feel not, that He might chasten us.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:64
verses.text: In His love He spared our bodies, and hasted to smite our wall.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:66
verses.text: Who has ever seen, that a breach became as a mirror? Two parties looked thereinto; it served for those without and those within.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:67
verses.text: They saw therein as with eyes, the Power that breaks down and builds up: they saw Him who made the breach and again repaired it.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:68
verses.text: Those without saw His might; they departed and tarried not till evening: those within saw His help; they gave thanks yet sufficed not.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:70
verses.text: Let the day of thy deliverance, arouse thee from sloth! When the wall was broken through, when the elephants pressed in, when the javelins showered, when men did valiantly, then was there a sight for the heavenly ones.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:71
verses.text: Iniquity fought there; mercy triumphed there; lovingkindness prevailed below; the watchers shouted on high.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:73
verses.text: And thine enemy wearied himself, striving to smite by his wiles, the wall that encompassed thee, a bulwark to thine inhabitants.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:74
verses.text: He wearied himself and availed not; and in order that he might not hope, that if He broke through He should also enter and take us captive, he broke it through and not once only; and was put to shame, nor was that enough, even unto three times, that he might be shamed thrice in the three.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 2:76
verses.text: Let my happiness by God's grace, be also multiplied in thy midst! Whereas in thee my crimes have been many, many be in thee my fruits! Whereas in thee I have sinned in my youth, in thee let there be mercy for my old age! By the mouth of thy sons pray for thy son, for I have sinned beyond my ability, and have repented below my ability; I have scattered above measure, and have gathered below measure.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:1
verses.text: Hymn III.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:3
verses.text: Fix thou our hearing, that it be not loosed and wander! For it is a-wandering if one enquire, who He is and what He is like.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:4
verses.text: For how can we avail, to paint in us the likeness, of that Being which is like to the mind? Naught is there in it that is limited, in all of it He sees and hears; all of it as it were speaks; all of it is in all senses.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:5
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:6
verses.text: , Praise to the One Being, that is to us unsearchable!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:7
verses.text: His aspect cannot be discerned, that it should be portrayed by our understanding: He hears without ears; He speaks without mouth; He works without hands, and He sees without eyes.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:8
verses.text: Because our soul ceases not nor desists, in presence of Him Who is such; in His graciousness He put on the fashion of humankind and gathered us into His likeness.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:10
verses.text: Let us learn in what way that Being is spiritual and appeared as corporeal; and how it also is tranquil and appears as wrathful.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:11
verses.text: These things were for our profit; that Being in our likeness was made like to us that we may be made like Him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:12
verses.text: One there is that is like Him, the Son Who proceeded from Him, Who is stamped with His likeness.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:14
verses.text: O Nisibis, hear these things, for, for thy sake these things were written and spoken.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:15
verses.text: Both to thyself and to others, thou hast been in the world a cause of strife and of disputations.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:16
verses.text: Mouths over thee, O thou that wast shut up, even over thee mouths sang; when thou didst triumph and wast enlarged, in thee mouths were opened, for lamentation and for thanksgiving.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:18
verses.text: The prayer of thy inhabitants, sufficed for thy deliverance; it was not that they were righteous, but that they were penitent: according as they were disgraced, so did they haste to submit to the rod.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:19
verses.text: In transgressions and in triumphs they had like part.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:20
verses.text: They whose crimes were great, so be their fruit great; they who triumphed in their sackcloth, have triumphed also in their crowns.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:22
verses.text: The day of thy deliverance, is king of all days.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:23
verses.text: The Sabbath overthrew thy walls, it overthrew the ungrateful; the day of the Resurrection of the Son, raised again thy ruins; the day of Resurrection raised thee according to its name, it glorified its title.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:24
verses.text: The Sabbath relaxed its watch; for the making of the breaches, it took blame to itself.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:26
verses.text: In Samaria hunger prevailed, but in thee fulness prevailed.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:27
verses.text: In Samaria there broke in and came on her, abundance of a sudden; but in thee there roared and came in on thee a sea of a sudden.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:28
verses.text: In her was eaten a child, and it saved her alive; in thee was eaten the body, living and all life-giving; of a sudden He delivered them, the Eaten delivered the eaters.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:30
verses.text: We know that the Blessed wills not the afflictions, that have been in all ages; though He has wrought them, it is our offences that are the cause of our troubles.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:31
verses.text: No man can complain against our Creator; it is for Him to complain against us, who have sinned and constrained Him, to be wrathful though He wills it not, and to smite though He desires it not.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:33
verses.text: The Earth, the vine, and the olive, are in need of chastisement.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:34
verses.text: When the olive is bruised, then its fruit smells sweet; when the vine is pruned, then its grapes are goodly; when the soil is ploughed its yield is goodly.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:35
verses.text: When water is confined in channels, desert places drink of it; brass, silver and gold, when they are burnished shine.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:37
verses.text: If then it be that man, by chastening makes all things goodly; and if he who despises and rejects chastening, is hated and all rebels against him; then by that which he chastens, let him learn Him that chastens him; since whoso chastens does so that he may profit thereby.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:38
verses.text: For whoso chastens his servants, does so that he may possess them; the good God chastens His servants that they may possess themselves.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:40
verses.text: Let thy afflictions be, books to admonish thee, for the thrice-besieged, suffice to become for thee, books to meditate therein, every hour on their histories.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:41
verses.text: Because thou despisedst the two Testaments, wherein thou mightest read thy life, therefore He wrote for thee, three hard books wherein thou shouldst read thy chastisements.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:43
verses.text: Let us avert by that which has been, the thing that is yet to be; let us be taught by that which has come, to escape that which is coming; let us remember that which is past, to avoid that which is future.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:44
verses.text: Because we had forgotten the first stroke, the second fell on us; because we forgot the second, the third bore heavy on us.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 3:45
verses.text: Who will yet again forget!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 4:1
verses.text: Hymn IV.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 4:3
verses.text: My God, without ceasing, I will tread the threshold of Thy house; I who have rejected all grace, I will ask with boldness, that I may receive with confidence.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 4:4
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 4:5
verses.text: , Our hope, be thou our Wall!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 4:6
verses.text: For if, O Lord, the earth, enriches manifold, a single grain of wheat, how then shall my prayers, be enriched by Thy grace!  3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 4:7
verses.text: Because of the voices of my children, their sighs and their groans, open to me the door of Thy mercy! Make glad for their voices, the mourning of their sackcloth!  4.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 4:8
verses.text: O firstborn that wast a weaned child, and wast familiar with the children, the accurst sons of Nazareth, hearken to my lambs that have seen the wolves, for lo! they cry.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 4:10
verses.text: For a flock, O my Lord, in the field, if so be it has seen the wolves, flees to the shepherd, and takes refuge under his staff, and he drives away them that would devour it.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 4:12
verses.text: Thy flock has seen the wolves, and lo! it cries loudly.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 4:13
verses.text: Behold how terrified it is! Let thy Cross be a staff, to drive out them that would swallow it up!  7.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 4:14
verses.text: Accept the cry of my little ones, that are altogether pure.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 4:15
verses.text: It was He, the Infant of days, that could appease, O Lord, the Ancient of days.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 4:17
verses.text: The day when the Babe came down, in the midst of the stall, the Watchers descended and proclaimed, peace—may that peace be, in all my streets for all my offspring.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 4:19
verses.text: Seventy and two old men, the elders of that people, sufficed not for its breaches.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 4:20
verses.text: The Babe it was, the Son of Mary, that gave peace on every side.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 4:22
verses.text: Have mercy, O Lord, on my children! in my children call to mind Thy childhood, Thou Who wast a child! Let them that are like Thy childhood, be saved by Thy grace!  11.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 4:23
verses.text: Mingled in the midst of the flock, are the cry of the innocents, and the voice of the sheep, that call on the Shepherd of all, to deliver them from all.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:2
verses.text: There is a joy that is affliction, misery is hidden in it; there is a misery that is profit, it is a fountain of joys, in that new world.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:4
verses.text: The happiness that my persecutor has gained, woes are hidden in it; therefore I rejoice.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:5
verses.text: The wretchedness that I have gained from him, happiness is concealed for me in it.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:7
verses.text: Who will not give praise, to Him that has begotten us, and can beget again, from the midst of evil rumours the voices of glad tidings!  16.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:8
verses.text: Thou Healer of all, hast visited me in my sicknesses! Payment for Thy medicines, I cannot give Thee, for they are priceless.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:10
verses.text: Thy mercies in richness, surpass Thy medicines: they cannot be bought, they are given freely, it is for tears they are bartered.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:12
verses.text: How, O my Master, can a desolate city, whose king is far off, and her enemy nigh, stand firm without aid of mercy?  19.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:13
verses.text: A harbour and refuge, art Thou at all times.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:14
verses.text: When the seas covered me, Thy mercy descended and drew me out.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:15
verses.text: Again let Thy help lay hold on me!  20.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:16
verses.text: Apply to my afflictions, the medicine of Thy salvation, and the passion of Thy help! Thy sign can become, a medicine to heal all.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:18
verses.text: I am greatly oppressed, and I hasten to complain, against him that troubles me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:19
verses.text: Let Thy mercy, my Lord, take the bitterness from the cup, that my sins have mixed.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:21
verses.text: I look on all sides, and weep that I am desolate.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:22
verses.text: Very many though be my chiefs and my deliverers, one is He that has delivered me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:24
verses.text: My young men have fled, O Lord, and gone forth, and are like chickens, which an eagle pursues; lo! they hide in a secret place: may Thy peace bring them back!  24.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:25
verses.text: The sound of my grape-gatherers, lo! my ears miss it, for their voices fail.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:26
verses.text: Let it resound with the glad tidings, O Blessed One of Thy salvation!  25.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:27
verses.text: A voice of terror, I have heard on my towers; as my defenders cry, while they guard my walls.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:28
verses.text: Still Thou it with the voice of peace!  26.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:29
verses.text: The noise of my husbandmen, shall speak peace without my walls: the shouting of my dwellers shall speak peace within my walls, that I may give peace without and within.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:31
verses.text: Make an end, O Lord, of the mourning, of this Thy pure altar, and of Thy chaste priest, who stands clothed in mourning, covered over with sackcloth!  28.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:32
verses.text: The Church and her ministers shall give praise for Thy salvation; the city and its dwellers.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 5:33
verses.text: Be the voice of peace, O Lord, the reward of their voices!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:1
verses.text: Hymn V.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:3
verses.text: Cause to be heard in Thy grace, the tidings of Thy salvation: for an hearing has been made, a path of passage; our minds have been downtrodden, by messages of terror.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:4
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:5
verses.text: , Praises to Thy victory! Glory to Thy Dominion!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:6
verses.text: Comfort Thou with profits, though small and scanty, those that have had harvest, of hurt by their labour: at a time of profit, they have gained but loss.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:8
verses.text: It is manifest that He has stood, portioning wrath upon earth: loss and profit in anger He divided.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:9
verses.text: There are whom He has cast down of a sudden, and there are whom He has puffed up of a sudden.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:11
verses.text: To teach us that He can, chastise in all ways; when He saw the persecutors, were terrible before mine eyes, He laid me out before my children, and they my beloved chastised me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:13
verses.text: Lo! He taught me to fear, Himself and not man: for when there was none to smite us, His wrath gave command of a sudden, and every man stretched himself out, and chastised himself.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:15
verses.text: In like manner that Babylonian, who struck down all kings when he was confident and hoped that there was none to smite him, God caused that by his own hands, he should strike himself down.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:17
verses.text: His majesty and his mind, of a sudden became mad together: he rent and cast off his garments; he went forth and wandered in the desert; he drove himself out first, and then his servants drove him out.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:19
verses.text: He showed to all kings, whom he had led captive and brought down, that not by his own power, could he have overcome: the power that struck him down, was that which punished them.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:21
verses.text: I have stood and borne, O my Lord; the blows of my deliverers.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:22
verses.text: Thou art able in Thy grace, to make me profit by the smiters: Thou art able in Thy justice to punish me by my helpers.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:24
verses.text: The day when the host was bold, to come up against Samaria; their plenty and their pleasure, their treasures and their possessions, they cast away and forsook and fled.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:25
verses.text: He crowned her by her persecutors.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:27
verses.text: My beloved ones crowned me, and my deliverers healed me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:28
verses.text: Through the guilt of my dwellers, my helpers chastised me, give me drink from Thy vines, of the cup of consolation!  12.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:29
verses.text: The corn and the vine, preserve, O my Lord, by Thy grace! Be the husbandman cheered, by the vine of the grape-gatherer; be the vinedresser glad, in the corn of the husbandman!  13.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:30
verses.text: They are joined each to each, the corn and the grape.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:31
verses.text: In the field the reapers, wine can make cheerful, in the vineyard the dressers, bread strengthens in turn.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:33
verses.text: These two things have power, to comfort my troubles: the Trinity has power, to comfort more exceedingly; whom I will praise because of a sudden, I was delivered through grace.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:35
verses.text: But the man whose life, is preserved through grace, if he goes away to murmur, at the loss of his goods, he is thankless for the grace, of Him who had pity on him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:37
verses.text: Of His own will He destroys, one thing instead of another.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:38
verses.text: He destroys possession, and spares the possessor: He destroys our plants, instead of our lives.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:40
verses.text: Let us fear to murmur, lest His own wrath be roused, and He spare the possessions, and smite the possessor; that we may learn in the end, His mercy in the beginning.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:42
verses.text: Let us learn against whom, it is meet for us to murmur.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:43
verses.text: Learn thou to murmur, not against the Chastener, but against thine own will, that made thee sin and thou wast punished.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:45
verses.text: Let us put away murmuring, and turn unto prayer: for if the possessor dies, his possessions also cease for him; but while he survives, he seeks to recover his losses.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:47
verses.text: Let consolations be multiplied, in mercy to my dwellers: let the remainder and residue, console us in the midst of wrath; and cause Thou us to forget in the residue, the mourning of our devastation!  21.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:48
verses.text: Heal and increase O my Lord, the fruits Thy wrath has left! They seem to me like sick ones, that have escaped in pestilence.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:49
verses.text: Make me to forget in these weak ones, the suffering of the many!  22.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:50
verses.text: While I speak, O my Lord, I call to mind that this too is the month, when the blossom pined, and dropped off in blight, may it return to soundness, to be a consolation!  23.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:51
verses.text: For these escaped the pestilence, that carried off their brethren.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:52
verses.text: The vines though voiceless, wept when before them, a multitude was cut down and felled, of trees that they loved.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:54
verses.text: The company of plants, lo! the earth misses! The roots for the husbandmen, weep and cause them to weep.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:55
verses.text: Their beauty had spread and gave shade, and it was torn away in one hour.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 6:57
verses.text: The axe came nigh and struck; and struck the husbandman; the blow was on the trees, and it caused the husbandman to suffer; every axe that smote, he bore the pain of it.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:1
verses.text: Hymn VI.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:3
verses.text: I will run in my affections, to Him who heals freely.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:4
verses.text: He who healed my sorrows, the first and the second, He who cured the third, He will heal the fourth.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:5
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:6
verses.text: , Heal me, Thou Son the First Born!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:7
verses.text: My sons, O my Lord, drank and were drunken, of the tidings which wrath had mixed; and they rushed on my adornments, and spoiled and cast away my ornaments; they rent and spared not, my garments and my crowns.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:9
verses.text: They uncovered me and I was made bare.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:10
verses.text: Because I was shamed a little, by means of that stripping, the first and the second, because I was shamed a third time, lo! they have stripped me a fourth time.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:12
verses.text: For they have seized and taken away my garments, my ornaments and my gardens.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:13
verses.text: On the sackcloth that girds my altar, look Thou, O my Lord, and have pity on me! Let the sackcloth be to me, O my Lord, the breastplate of salvation!  5.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:14
verses.text: Lo! it is not by the hand of the chaste, that Thou hast chastised me, O my Master! For lo! his shame is before him, and behind him his disgrace; for as to his marriage, adultery is better than it.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:16
verses.text: Lo! his daughter is his wife, and his sister his consort; and his mother whence he came forth, he turns again and takes her to wife! The heavens are astonished that thus, he provokes Thee, and lo! he prospers.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:18
verses.text: And though, O my Lord, my crimes are many, are my offences so heavy, that Thou shouldst make over a chaste woman, mother of chaste daughters, to foul Assyria, mother of defiled daughters?  8.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:19
verses.text: Restrain him that he come not, and wag at me his head, and stamp on me his heel, and rejoice that the voice of his fame, thus troubles the world; and be uplifted yet a little!  9.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:20
verses.text: My sons, O my Lord, have seen my nakedness, yea have uncovered me and wept.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:21
verses.text: Uncover Thou me before my children, who are pained by my pain, and let not those mock at me, the accursed that have no pity!  10.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:22
verses.text: My lands had brought forth fruits and pleasant things; good things in the vineyard, abundance in the fields.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:23
verses.text: But as I rested secure, of a sudden wrath overtook me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:25
verses.text: The husbandmen were plundered, the spoilers heaped the grain; what thou had borrowed and sown these destroyed.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:26
verses.text: With one's debt his hunger, haply will also remain unsatisfied, for his bread is snatched from him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:28
verses.text: The husbandman, O my Lord, is plundered, for he lent to the earth; she has received the deposit, and given it to a stranger; she has borrowed it of the husbandman; and paid it to the spoiler.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:30
verses.text: Be jealous over me who am Thine, and to Thee, O my Lord: am I betrothed! The Apostle who betrothed me to Thee, told me that Thou art jealous.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:31
verses.text: For as a wall to chaste wives is the jealousy of their husbands.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:33
verses.text: Samson stirred up seas, because he was mightily jealous over his wife, though she was greatly defiled, and was divided against him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:34
verses.text: Keep Thy Church, for no other, has she beside Thee!  15.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:35
verses.text: Whoso is not jealous, over his spouse despises her.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:36
verses.text: Jealousy it is that can make known, the love that is within.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:37
verses.text: Thou art called jealous, that thou mayest show me Thy love.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:39
verses.text: The nature of woman is this; it is weak and rash: it is jealousy keeps it, under fear every hour.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:40
verses.text: Thou hast been named among the jealous, that Thou mightest make known Thy solicitude.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:42
verses.text: Every man has been master, of something that was not his own; every man has gone forth gathering, something that he scattered not.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:43
verses.text: The day of confusion, I have prepared for myself by my crimes.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:45
verses.text: How shall they bear the suffering, the labourers and tillers? In the face of the vinedresser, they have cut down the vines and driven away the flocks of the husbandman; his sowing they have reaped and carried off.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:47
verses.text: They had yoked cattle sown and harrowed, they had ploughed, planted, nurtured.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:48
verses.text: They stood afar and wept; and they went away bereft of all.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:49
verses.text: The labour was for the toilers, the increase for the spoilers.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:51
verses.text: The rulers, O my Lord, maintained not, order in the midst of Thy wrath.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:52
verses.text: If they had willed it they might have kept order, but our iniquity suffered it not.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:53
verses.text: Though wrath had greatly abated, wrath compelled them to spoil.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:55
verses.text: To whom on any side, shall I look for comfort, for my plantations that are laid low, and my possessions that are laid waste? Let the message of the voice of peace, drive away my sadness from me!  22.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:56
verses.text: Give me not over; lest it be thought that Thou, hast given me a writing of divorce, and sent me away and driven me out! Let them not call me, O my Lord, the forsaken and the disgraced!  23.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:57
verses.text: I have not anything, to call to mind before Thine eyes, for I am wholly despised.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:58
verses.text: Call Thou to mind for me, O my God, this only that none other, have I set before me beside Thee!  24.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:59
verses.text: Who would not weep for me, with voice and wailing? for before the days of full moon I was chaste and crowned; and after the days of full moon, I was uncovered and made bare.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:61
verses.text: My chaste daughters of the chambers, wander in the fields; for the wrath that makes all drunken, has caused my honourable women to be despised.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:62
verses.text: Let Thy mercy which gives peace to all, restore these beloved ones to honour!  26.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:63
verses.text: My elder daughters and my younger, lo! they cry before Thee; the damsels with their voices, they that are aged with their tears; my virgins with their fasts, my chaste ones with their sackcloth!  27.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:64
verses.text: Mine eyes to all the streets, I lift up and lo! they are deserted.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:65
verses.text: There are left of a hundred ten, and a thousand of ten thousand.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:66
verses.text: Give Thou peace and fill my streets, with the tumult of my dwellers!  28.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:67
verses.text: Bring back them that are without, and make them glad that are within! Mighty is Thy grace, that Thou extendest it within and without.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:68
verses.text: Let the wings of Thy grace gather my chickens together!  29.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:69
verses.text: Let the prayer of my just men, save my fugitives! The unbelievers have plundered me, and the believers have sustained me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:70
verses.text: In them that believe put Thou to shame them that believe not!  30.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:71
verses.text: There came together on one day, two festivals as one: the Feast of Thine Ascension, and the Feast of Thy Champions; the feast that wove Thy Crown, and the memorial of the crowning of Thy servants.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:73
verses.text: Have thou mercy because there were doubled for us, these feasts on one day; and there were doubled for us instead of them, even the two feasts in one, suffering from the voice of ill tidings, and mourning from desolation!  32.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:74
verses.text: Give peace to my festivals! for both my feasts have ceased; and instead of rejoicing, of my remnants in festivals, tremblings and desolations meet me in every place.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 7:76
verses.text: Bring home mine that are far off, make glad mine that are nigh; and in the midst of our land shall be preached, good tidings of joy; and I shall render in return for peace, praise from every mouth!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 8:1
verses.text: Hymn VII.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 8:3
verses.text: Wrath came to rebuke, the greedy who in the midst of peace, bargained, defrauded and plundered.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 8:4
verses.text: In calamity the greedy have waxed rich: lo! what was theirs they have scattered, what was not theirs they have gathered.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 8:5
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 8:6
verses.text: , Give peace, O Son, to our land!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 8:7
verses.text: Twenty years my troubles, have been like branches, O my Saviour! which are kept back throughout winter, but when it is time to shoot forth, my troubles shoot forth: with our fruit our heart ripens.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 8:9
verses.text: Nisan is the time of buds: in it the ill tidings budded.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 8:10
verses.text: When our delights crowded on us, then crowded on us our ills.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 8:11
verses.text: At the time of winnowing of wheat, came the winnowing of cities,  4.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 8:12
verses.text: For the three brethren in Babylon fled not from the fire that men kindled, because they were steadfast: from lust they fled, because they were perfect.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 8:14
verses.text: The fire of them that have triumphed, is able to turn the black kids into white: the fire of vain men is able to make the lambs into spotted leopards.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 8:16
verses.text: How great will be my cries, to be cried at any alarm! How great my indignation to ripen at every ill tidings! How great my harvests, to perish every mouth!  7.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 8:17
verses.text: For the crimes of my sons He has chastened me, in their struggling for my deliverance.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 8:18
verses.text: The people who deliver me, bring chastisement upon me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 8:19
verses.text: Restrain ye your sins, and lo! my chastisements are restrained!  8.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 8:20
verses.text: In ill tidings they are afflicted; in time of wrath they are tortured; in time of peace they are distressed; for when every man breathes freely, and all are unthankful for grace, they render thanks on behalf of every man.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 8:22
verses.text: Their sackcloth is humble for my sake; their ashes are sprinkled in my affliction; their prayer is for my victory; their fast for my deliverance: Lo! the debt is on my ascetics, the guilt with my nobles.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 8:24
verses.text: Great is in every age, the folly of the wise; the scribes and elders envied and killed the teacher, who taught all people the Law of Moses.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 8:26
verses.text: Wisdom in this age is a possession that brings loss: he who has a little folly, very small is his guilt; but he who has a little prudence, his iniquity passes measure.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 8:28
verses.text: They build with their words, and overthrow in their deeds; for the teachers were many and foolish, but the mouth of the judge is both of these things, the judge and the accuser.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:1
verses.text: Hymn XIII.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:2
verses.text: Concerning Mar Jacob and his Companions.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:4
verses.text: Three illustrious priests, after the manner of the two great lights,—have carried on and handed down one to another, the See and the Hand and the Flock.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:5
verses.text: —To us whose mounting was great for the two, this last is wholly a consolation.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:6
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:7
verses.text: , Glory to Thee Who didst choose them!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:8
verses.text: He Who created two great lights, chose for Himself these three Lights,—and set them in the three dark seasons of siege that have been.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:9
verses.text: —When that pair of Lights was quenched, the other shone wholly forth.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:11
verses.text: These three priests were treasures, who held in their faithfulness,—the key of the Trinity; three doors they opened for us;—each one of them with his key, unlocked and opened his door.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:13
verses.text: In the first was opened the door, for the chastisement that befel us;—in the next was opened the door, for the King's power that came down on us,—in the last was opened the door, for the good tidings that came up for us.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:15
verses.text: In the first was opened the door, for battle between two hosts;—in the next were opened doors, for the kings from either wind;—in the last was opened the door, for ambassadors from either side.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:17
verses.text: In the first was opened the door, for battle because of misdeeds;—in the next was opened the door,—for the kings because of strife;—in the last was opened the door, for ambassadors because of mercies.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:19
verses.text: Lo! in these three successions, as in a mystery and a figure,—wrath is likened to the sun; it began under the first;—it waxed strong under the next; it sank and was quenched under the last.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:21
verses.text: Three figures the Sun also, shows forth in the three quarters:—its rising is keen and bright; its meridian strong and overpowering;—and like a torch that is burnt out, its setting is mild and pleasant.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:23
verses.text: Small yet bright is its rising, when it comes to waken sleepers;—hot and overpowering its meridian, when it comes to ripen the fruits;—tender and pleasant its setting, when it reaches its consummation.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:25
verses.text: Who is this daughter born of vows, enviable above all women,—whose successions thus proceed, and her ranks are thus manifold,—and her degrees thus ascend, and her teachers thus excel.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:27
verses.text: Do these similitudes belong, only to the daughter of Abraham,—or to thee too, O daughter, born of vows, whose adorning is according as thy beauty?—for as thine occasion, so was thy help, and as thy help so was its minister.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:29
verses.text: According to the measure of her need, there came to her the supply of her need.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:30
verses.text: —Her fathers were as was her birth; her teachers were as was her understanding;—her training as was her growth; her raiment as was her stature.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:32
verses.text: Grace weighed out to her and gave all these things as in the scales;—she laid them in her balance, that therefrom there might be profit;—she drew them into succession, that therefrom might be perfection.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:34
verses.text: In the days of him that was first, peace abounded and peace vanished;—in the days of him that was next, kings came down and kings went back;—but in the days of the last, hosts assailed and hosts retreated.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:36
verses.text: By the first order came in, it came in with him and went out with him;—by the next the diadem that gladdened our churches, came nigh and withdrew far away;—but by the last there dawned on us, grace that was not thankfully received.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:38
verses.text: Against the wrath that was first, the labour of the first contended;—against the heat that was at noon, the shade of the second stood up;—against peace that was thankless, the last multiplied warnings.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:40
verses.text: For the first invader of the land was the first and illustrious priest;—for the second invader of the land, was the second and merciful priest:—but the prayers of him that was last, repaired our breaches secretly.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:42
verses.text: Nisibis is set upon waters, waters secret and open:—living streams are within her; a noble river without her.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:43
verses.text: The river without deceived her; the fountain within has saved her.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:45
verses.text: The first priest was her vinedresser; he made her branches to grow even unto heaven.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:46
verses.text: —Lo! being dead and buried within her, he has become fruit in the midst of her bosom:—when therefore the pruners came, the fruit that was in her midst preserved her.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:48
verses.text: The time of her pruning came; it entered and took from her her vinedresser,—that there should not be one to pray for her.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:49
verses.text: She made haste in her subtlety;—He laid in her bosom her vinedresser, that she should be delivered through her vinedresser.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:51
verses.text: Be ye wise like Nisibis, O ye daughters of Nisibis,—for that she laid the body within her, and it became a wall without her.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 9:52
verses.text: —Place ye within you the living body, that it be a wall for your lives!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:1
verses.text: Hymn IX.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:2
verses.text: …My afflictions are as Job's.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:3
verses.text: Thy justice delivered him; let Thy grace have mercy on me!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:4
verses.text: In these two things is profit; that neither should the just, be weary in supplication, nor should the rebellious, multiply transgression.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:6
verses.text: With the sons Thou labourest, to chastise and help them; and that the fathers should not be grieved, by the sound of the scourge, they left me in peace.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:8
verses.text: Look, O my Lord, on my woods without, how they have been cut down! behold, O my Lord, my breasts within, that they are too weak, for me to bear my beloved ones!  5.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:9
verses.text: With swords they have cut off, my wings that are without; again the fire kindles, in my bosom within, the incense of burnt offering.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:11
verses.text: The sun-worshippers have killed, my sons in the plain: and they that offer to Baal, have sacrificed my bulls in the city, my sheep with my babes.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:13
verses.text: In my fields is lamentation; in my halls wailing; in my vineyards terror; in my streets confusion.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:14
verses.text: Who can suffice for me?  8.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:15
verses.text: The Evil One who dealt treacherously, and disturbed me with his words, stirred up trouble within, so that my inward part, is wholly as my outward part.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:17
verses.text: With what face, O my Lord, shall I call on Thee to send, a camp of holy ones, to guard my bosom, which is full of uncleanness?  10.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:18
verses.text: With Thy new leaven, Thou hast chastened creation.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:19
verses.text: Make Thou the old leaven, which ensnares and humbles, to be like the new leaven!  11.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:20
verses.text: By the manifest striving, of Thy power let us conquer; lest error should crown, those that strive for Thee, cleaving to them with blandishment!  12.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:21
verses.text: If we look into our time, it is like our deceit;—for in the years of truthfulness, we practised divinations,—and secretly used enchantments.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:23
verses.text: If I look into the time, it provokes and into light,—brings secret things, that our deceit may be shamed,—which wore the raiment of Truth.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:25
verses.text: Verily it is truth, that overcomes all;—and the sea with its bitterness, cannot trouble it,—for it is pure in its nature.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:27
verses.text: In wisdom Thou hast made it, O my Lord, that it has laid bare our lust.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:28
verses.text: —That the foolish should come to nought, and should not be encouraged,—Truth has withheld the crown.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:30
verses.text: On the tottering walls, whereon Thou hast given me victory,—the unthankful repay Thee, with sacrifice and libation, which provoke Thee openly.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:32
verses.text: If it were at that time, sacrifices had been offered;—there had been room even, for delusion to suppose,—that in these I was delivered.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 10:34
verses.text: Through the multitude of deliverances, Thou hast rebuked two things:—the delusion of graven images, and the teaching of magicians;—for in Thee, O my Lord, have I been delivered!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:1
verses.text: Hymn X.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:3
verses.text: My children have been slain; and my daughters that are without me,—their walls are overthrown, their children scattered,—and their holy places trodden down.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:4
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:5
verses.text: , Blessed is Thy chastisement!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:6
verses.text: The fowlers have taken, my doves out of my strongholds,—which quitted their nests, and fled to the caves;—in the net have they taken them.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:8
verses.text: After the manner of wax, that melts before the fire,—thus melted and dissolved, the bodies, of my sons before the heat—and the drought of my strongholds.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:10
verses.text: And instead of streams, of milk that used to flow,—for my sons and my little ones, milk fails the sucklings, and water the weaned children.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:12
verses.text: The suckling falls, from its mother and gasps,—because it cannot suck, nor can she give suck:—they breathe out their spirit and die.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:14
verses.text: How is it possible, that Thy grace can refrain—the welling of its stream, when it is not possible to restrain—the abundance of its flow?  7.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:15
verses.text: And why has Thy grace, shut up its mercies,—and withheld its streams, from the people that cry,—for one to moisten their tongue?  8.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:16
verses.text: And there was a pit, between them and their brethren;—like the rich man who cried, and there was none to answer,—to moisten his tongue.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:18
verses.text: And as into the midst of fire, the wretched ones were cast;—and heat in the midst of thirst, the fire was blowing,—and kindling upon them.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:20
verses.text: Their carcases were melted, and dissolved by the heat;—they that had thirsted gave in turn the earth to drink,—of the reek of their bodies.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:22
verses.text: And the fort that with thirst, had killed, its dwellers,—it drank in its turn of the flux from the corpses,—that were melted by thirst.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:24
verses.text: Who has seen a people—that were burning with thirst,—while there surrounded them a wall of water and they could not—moisten their tongue!  13.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:25
verses.text: Surely with the judgment of Sodom, were my beloved judged,—and my children smitten, with the torment of Sodom;—though that was but for one day.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:27
verses.text: The torment of fire, though it be for one hour, O my Lord,—in lingering thirst, is a lingering death, and a subtle punishment.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:29
verses.text: After my sorrows, O my Lord, and my bitter sufferings,—this is the best comfort, wherewith Thou hast comforted me,—that Thou hast multiplied my afflictions.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:31
verses.text: The medicine that I hoped, it is sorrow decreed;—the binding up that I looked for, it is bitter calamity,—that it seeks to work for me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:33
verses.text: And whereas I hoped to escape, from the midst of the storm;—worse for me is the storm in it, even in the harbour,—than that in the sea.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:35
verses.text: Whereas I thought in my folly, that I should anchor and escape—from the midst of the Gulf; my sins have cast me back—again into the midst of it.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:37
verses.text: Look, O my Lord, on my limbs, how the swords are thick in me,—and have left their mark on my arms; and the scars of the spears,—are planted in my sides!  20.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 11:38
verses.text: Tears in mine eyes, and in my ears ill rumours,—wailing in my mouth, and mourning in my heart!—Add no more, O my Lord, to me!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:1
verses.text: Hymn XI.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:3
verses.text: Thy chastening is, as a mother of our infancy:—her rebuke is merciful, in that Thou hast restrained,—the children from folly, and they have been made wise! R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:4
verses.text: , Glory be to thy justice!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:5
verses.text: Let us search out Thy justice; for who is sufficient—to measure its help? since by it the wanton—are oftentimes made chaste.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:7
verses.text: Oftentimes Thy hand, O my Lord, has made the sick whole,—for it is the healer in secret of their diseases,—and the fount of their life.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:9
verses.text: Exceeding gently, the finger of Thy justice,—in love and compassion, touches the wounds—of him that is to be healed.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:11
verses.text: Exceeding mild and merciful, is her cutting to him that is wise:—her sharp remedy, in its mighty love,—consumes the corrupt part.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:13
verses.text: Exceeding welcome her wrath, to him that is discerning;—but her remedies are hated, of the fool who has delight—in the trouble of his limbs.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:15
verses.text: Exceeding eager is she, to bind the cut she has made;—when she has smitten she pities, that from between these two—she may breed healing.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:17
verses.text: Exceeding welcome her wrath, and her anger pleasant,—and sweet her bitterness, sweetening bitter things—that they may be made pleasant.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:19
verses.text: A cause of negligence is Thy indulgence to the careless;—a cause of profit, is Thy rod among the slothful—so that they become as traffickers.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:21
verses.text: The cause of our affliction, it is Thy justice;—the cause of our carelessness, it is Thy graciousness,—for our understanding has turned foolish.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:23
verses.text: Pharaoh hardened himself, because of Thy graciousness;—for when the plagues were stayed, his cruelties waxed strong,—and he lied to his promises.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:25
verses.text: Justice requited him, because he lied greatly against her,—even Grace her freeborn sister; yea she restrained him again—that he should not again provoke.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:27
verses.text: Rebuke, O my Lord, my guide, for it has been false as Egypt —my prayers testify, that I am not as she,—for Thy door have I not forsaken.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:29
verses.text: Let Thy cross, O my Lord, which stands, in my breaches that are open,—repair again the breaches that are hidden; for instead of those without,—those within have cleft me asunder!  15.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:30
verses.text: A sea has broken through, and cast down, the watch tower wherein I had triumphed.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:31
verses.text: —Iniquity has dared to set up, a temple wherein I am shamed: its drink-offering chokes me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:33
verses.text: My prayers on my walls, my persecutors have heard:—the sun and his worshippers, are ashamed of their magicians,—for I have triumphed by Thy cross.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:35
verses.text: All creatures cried out, when they saw the struggle,—while Truth with falsehood, on my battered walls, fought and was crowned conqueror.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:37
verses.text: The force of Truth, chastised falsehood:—in its chastisement it felt Truth, and through its own sins, it earned her victory.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:39
verses.text: I have great alarm; for since my deliverance,—the honourable and mighty, who were devoted to my altar, have built in me high places.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:41
verses.text: My seven senses, O my Lord, even though they had been as fountains of tears, yet my tears were too little—to lament our ruin.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:43
verses.text: The streets that were in sackcloth, and ashes cried out,—disturbed by the play, akin to that which was,—in the wilderness before the calf.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 12:45
verses.text: Poison seeks and wears, the beauty of lilies;—and though their buds may conceal, and hidden disguise it,—it blossoms in their bitter flowers.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 13:1
verses.text: Hymn XII.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 13:3
verses.text: I will call in my affliction, on the Power that subdues all;—that is able to subdue, the Captor in his wrath,—as it overcame Legion.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 13:4
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 13:5
verses.text: , Glory to His grace!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 13:6
verses.text: The Evil One has repaid me my brethren, debts that he borrowed not of me:—the good God likewise has repaid me, mercies that I lent Him not.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 13:7
verses.text: —Come and marvel ye at these two things!  3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 13:8
verses.text: The good God has divided and given, my misdeeds to His grace,—my offences to His justice; His mercy has blotted out my misdeeds—His judgment has requited my offences.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 13:10
verses.text: Sin was exceeding wroth, and abode in alarm,—when she saw how grace, put restraint on freedom, that she might overcome transgressions.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 13:12
verses.text: Glow Thou, O my Lord, and send down Thy love, break out and pour forth Thy wrath!—Thy wrath to destroy, Thy love to rescue—the captives from the captor!  6.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 13:13
verses.text: The days wherein the Evil One, decreed to cast me forth,—as with a sling into perdition, in them the good God has bound up and kept—my soul in the bundle of life.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 13:15
verses.text: The men of speech who keep not silence, from praising continually,—who have kept me in the midst of waves, and supported me that I fell not, let them give praise in my stead, O my Lord!  8.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 13:16
verses.text: For who has at any time sufficed, in presence of the grace,—of the mercies which surrounded him, that I should suffice to praise—the mercies that encompass me?.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:1
verses.text: Hymn XIV.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:3
verses.text: Under the three pastors,—there were manifold shepherds;—the one mother that was in the city,—had daughters in all regions.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:4
verses.text: —Since Wrath has destroyed her dwellings,—Peace shall build up her churches.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:5
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:6
verses.text: Blessed be He who chose out those three!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:7
verses.text: The kindly labour of the first,—bound up the land in her affliction:—the bread and wine of the next,—healed the city when site was broken:—the sweet speech of the last,—sweetened our bitterness in affliction.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:9
verses.text: The first tilled the land with his labour,—he rooted out of her the briars and thorns:—the next fenced her round about,—he made a hedge for her of them that were saved:—the last opened the garner of his Lord,—and sowed in her the words of her Lord.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:11
verses.text: The first priest by means of a fast,—closed up the doors of men's mouths:—the second priest for the captives,—opened the mouths of the purse:—but the last pierced through the ears,—and fastened in them the ornament of life.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:13
verses.text: Aaron stripped off from the ears,—the earrings and made a calf.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:14
verses.text: —That lifeless calf in secret,—pierced and slaughtered the camp:—those who had fashioned his horns, —he ripped them up with his horns.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:16
verses.text: But our priest who was the third,—pierced through the ears of the heart:—and fastened there the earrings he had fashioned,—of the nails that were fixed in the cross, —whereon his Lord was crucified,—and gave life to His fellow-men.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:18
verses.text: A son unto death the fire brought forth;—Death feeds upon all bodies:—the son of Death who surpassed Death,—upon the souls of men he fed.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:19
verses.text: —The calf forsook his provender,—for men's minds were the food for him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:21
verses.text: To the first Tree that which killed,—to it grace brought forth a son.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:22
verses.text: —O Cross offspring of the Tree,—that didst fight against thy sire!—The Tree was the fount of death;—the Cross was the fount of life.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:24
verses.text: The son that was born to Death,—all mouths were opened to curse him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:25
verses.text: —He devoured bodies and souls,—and multiplied the disgrace of his father.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:26
verses.text: —But the Cross caused to pass away the rebuke,—of its father that first Tree.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:28
verses.text: The two sons were even as were—the two mothers that bare them.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:29
verses.text: —The calf which the fire brought forth,—the fire consumed in the midst of the people:—the Cross the offspring of grace,—divided good gifts to all creation.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:31
verses.text: O my tongue hold thy peace and be silent of the histories of the Cross that press to be told!—for my mind of a sudden has conceived,—and lo! pangs of travail smite it:—it has conceived these among the last,—and they strive to become the firstborn.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:33
verses.text: The babes struggled in the womb;—the elder made haste to come forth:—the younger desiring the birthright,—laid his hand upon his heel;—that which he obtained not by birth,—he obtained by the mess of pottage.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:35
verses.text: After the like sort these later histories,—lo! they make light of the former ones,—that themselves may come forth and take the birthright.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:36
verses.text: —Let us bring forth the history of our fathers,—for lo! the histories of the Cross—are the firstborn of all creatures.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:38
verses.text: For if that which has no beginning—is the first of all created things,—its histories also are the firstborn,—for they are elder than all creatures.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:39
verses.text: —Let the histories of Thee, O my Lord, yield place,—that we may tell of Thy ministers!  15.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:40
verses.text: The first in degree of doctrine,—His eloquence was like as was his degree;—the next who was second in degree,—his interpretation mounted to the height of his degree;—the last who was third in degree,—his eloquence was great as he was.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:42
verses.text: The first in his simple words,—gave milk unto his infants;—the next in his plain sayings,—gave victual to his children;—the third in his perfect sayings,—gave meat to his that were of perfect age.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:44
verses.text: She too the daughter of instruction,—mounted from degree to degree,—along with her teachers and fathers.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:45
verses.text: —A young child she was with the first; a simple maid was she with the next;—she came to perfect age in the third.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:47
verses.text: The first dealing with her as a child,—loved her and taught her to fear;—the next as with a damsel, rebuked her and make her glad;—the third as with one fully instructed,—was to her a solace of pleasantness.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:49
verses.text: Even the Most High with the daughter of Jacob,—gave blandishment and the rod to her childhood;—and in her frowardness and full age,—gave part in the sword and the Law;—and according to her discipline and instruction,—He came to her in mildness and pleasantness.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:51
verses.text: The first that begat the flock,—his bosom bare her infancy;—the next of glad-some countenance,—cheered with song and made glad her childhood;—the last grave of countenance,—lo! he guards her chastity in her youth.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:53
verses.text: The first priest who begat her,—gave milk to her infancy;—the next priest interpreted,—and gave victual to her childhood;—the third priest nourished her, and gave meat to her perfect age.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:55
verses.text: The wealthy father who was first,—laid up treasures for her childhood;—the next for her maturity—multiplied provision for her journey;—the third the goodly olive tree,—multiplied oil in her vessels.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:57
verses.text: When she comes before Him who is rich,—she will show the treasure of the first;—when she comes before the Saviour, she will show the saved ones of the next;—when she goes forth to meet the Bridegroom,—she will show the oil of her lamps.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:59
verses.text: Before Him who rewards the weary toilworn,—she will offer the labour of the first;—before Him who loves cheerful givers,—she will show the almsgiving of the next;—before Him who judges doctrines,—she will offer the discourse of the last.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:61
verses.text: And I the sinner who have striven to be—the disciple of these three,—when they shall see Him of the Third Day,—that he has closed the door of His chamber,—may these three pray Him for me, that He keep the door open a little while for me!  26.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 14:62
verses.text: May the sinner press into and enter—rejoicing and fearing to behold!—May the three masters call in—the one disciple in their grace!—May he gather up under the table—the crumbs that are full of life!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:1
verses.text: Hymn XV.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:3
verses.text: If the head had not been right,—haply the members had murmured:—for when because of a perverse head—the course of the members is put astray,—they are wont to lay the blame on the head.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:4
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:5
verses.text: Blessed be He who chose thee the pride of our people!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:6
verses.text: If now on one that is all goodly,—on it we lay our hatred;—how much more if we were hateful!—Yea even God though He is kind,—bitter men complain against Him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:8
verses.text: Be like the head O ye members!—Get repose in his purity—and pleasantness in his tranquillity;—in his sanctity renown,—and in his wisdom learning!  4.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:9
verses.text: Get discernment in his mildness,—and chastity in his gravity,—and bounty in his poverty!—As he is fully and altogether fair,—let us be altogether fair with him!  5.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:10
verses.text: See ye how meted and weighed—are his words and his actions!—Take heed how even his steps—keep the measure of peace!—With all his might he holds the bridle of all himself.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:12
verses.text: He was master over his youth;—he bound it in the yoke of chastity:—his members were not enticed by lust;—for they were kept under the rod:—his will he had in subjection.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:14
verses.text: For he was ready beforehand for his degree,—as he was ready beforehand in his conversation,—as he laid his foundations securely.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:15
verses.text: —He became Head in his youth,—when they made him preacher to the people.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:17
verses.text: Excellent was he among preachers,—learned was he among scholars,—and understanding was he among the wise:—chaste was he among his brethren,—and grave among his familiar friends.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:19
verses.text: In two abodes was he—a solitary recluse from his early days;—for he was holy within his body,—and solitary within his dwelling;—openly and secretly was he chaste.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:21
verses.text: But although we my brethren—have put astray those measures,—and we have lost that savour,—and have become teachers to ourselves,—unto the perfection that called us.
