verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:23
verses.text: Yet that measure of Truth—preserves itself in its vessel:—Truth chose it because she saw it chose her;—she has preserved in it her fragrance and savour,—from the beginning to the end.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:25
verses.text: The Head both chaste and grave,—that was not wrathful nor hard,—nor transgressed even as we did,—set and kept his own measures,—and cast a bridle on his thoughts.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:27
verses.text: He gave example in his person,—that as he kept the measure of his time,—so was it meet that we should know our time.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:28
verses.text: —We have become strangers to our time,—for we have been witless in the time of discernment.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:30
verses.text: In the beginning the blast of the wind—in its might chastens the fruit;—then in the meantime the might of the sun:—but when its mightiness is passed,—its end gathers his sweetness.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:32
verses.text: But we—they that were first chastened us;—and also they that came next rebuked us;—and they that were last added sweetness to us:—then when the time of tasting us arrives,—great was our savourlessness.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:34
verses.text: For we came to maturity,—that we might wean the children from wantonness,—and lead them to gravity:—but our old age stood in need—that we should be rebuked as youths.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:36
verses.text: Accordingly he in kindness endured, nor did he make use of force,—that he might increase honour to our old age:—and even if it knew not its degree,—let him be magnified who knew its time!  18.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:37
verses.text: And if one say that for the multitude,—force and the rod should govern it;—even as for the thief fear,—and for the spoiler threatening,—and for fools open shaming.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:39
verses.text: Yet if with the head as first,—the members had hasted to move as second,—they would have drawn that which was third,—and the whole body from the end—would have followed after them.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:41
verses.text: They that were second despised those that were first,—and that were third those that were second:—the degrees were set at naught one by another.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 15:42
verses.text: —While these within despised one another,—they were trodden down likewise by those without.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 16:1
verses.text: Hymn XVI.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 16:3
verses.text: Herein is a mirror to be blamed,—if its clearness is darkened—because there are spots on its substance;—for the foulness that is on it becomes—a covering before them that look on it.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 16:4
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 16:5
verses.text: Blessed be He Who polished our mirror!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 16:6
verses.text: For that comeliness is not adorned in it,—and blemishes are not brought to view in it,—it is altogether a damage to comely things;—seeing that their comeliness gain not—adornments as their profit.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 16:8
verses.text: Blemishes are not rooted out by it,—likewise adornments are not multiplied by it.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 16:9
verses.text: —A blemish that remains is as a loss;—that there is no adornment is a defect:—loss is met together with defect.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 16:11
verses.text: If our mirror be darkness,—it is altogether joy to the hateful;—because their blemishes are not reproved:—but if polished and shining,—it is our freedom that is adorned.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 16:13
verses.text: Twofold is the loss in defect,—for the hateful and for the goodly;—in that the goodly gain no crown,—and likewise the hateful get no adorning:—the mirror divides the loss.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 16:15
verses.text: Never does the mirror drive—by compulsion him that looks therein:—so likewise grace which followed—upon the righteousness of the Law,—does not possess the compulsion of the Law.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 16:17
verses.text: Righteousness was unto childhood,—its adorner of compulsion;—for when mankind was in childhood,—she adorned it by compulsion,—while she robbed it not of its freedom.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 16:19
verses.text: Righteousness used blandishment,—and the rod to deal with childhood;—when she smote it she roused it; her rod restrained frowardness, her blandishment softened the minds.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 17:2
verses.text: [If one turn from the Gospel,] wherewith we are adorned to-day, my brethren,—to another gospel he is a child:—in a time of greatness of understanding,—he is become without understanding.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 17:4
verses.text: For in the degree of full age,—he has gone down to childhood;—and he loves the law of bondmen,—which when he is confident smites him,—and when he rejoices buffets him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 17:6
verses.text: Whatsoever ornament is compulsion,—is not true but is borrowed.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 17:7
verses.text: —This is a great thing in God's eyes,—that a man should be adorned by himself:—therefore took He away compulsion.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 17:9
verses.text: For even as of His prudence—in its own time He employed compulsion,—so likewise of His prudence,—He took it away at a time—when gentleness was desired in its stead.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 17:11
verses.text: For as it is befitting to Youth,—that it should be made to haste under the rod;—so is it very hateful that under the rod—Wisdom should be brought to serve,—that compulsion should be lord over her.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 17:13
verses.text: Behold therefore how likewise—God has ordered my successions—in the pastors I have had,—and in the teachers He has given me,—and in the fathers He has reckoned unto me!  15.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 17:14
verses.text: For weighed out according to their times—were the helps of their qualities;—namely in him in whom it was needful, fear; and in whom it was profitable, heartening; and in whom it was becoming, meekness.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 17:16
verses.text: By measure He made my steps advance:—to my childhood He assigned terror; likewise to my youth, fear;—to my age of wisdom and prudence,—He assigned and gave meekness.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 17:18
verses.text: In the frowardness of the degree of childhood,—my instructor was a fear to me:—his rod restrained me from wantonness,—and from mischief the terror of him,—and from indulgence the fear of him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 17:20
verses.text: Another father He gave to my youth:—what there was in me of childishness,—that was there in him of hardness; what there was in me of maturity,—that was in him as meekness.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 17:22
verses.text: When I rose from the degrees—of childhood and of youth,—there passed away the terror that was first,—there passed away the fear that was second;—He gave me a kind pastor.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 17:24
verses.text: Lo! for my full age his food;—and for my wisdom his interpretations;—and for my peace his meekness;—and for my repose his kindness;—and for my chastity his gravity!  21.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 17:25
verses.text: Blessed is He who as in a balance—weighed out and gave me fathers:—for according to my times were my helps;—and according to my sicknesses my medicines;—and according to my comelinesses my adornments!  22.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 17:26
verses.text: We then are they that have disturbed—the succession and fair order;—for in a time of mildness—lo! we crave for hardness,—that Thou should rebuke us as though we were children!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:1
verses.text: Hymn XVII.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:2
verses.text: Concerning Abraham, Bishop of Nisibis.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:4
verses.text: Suffer, O Lord, that even my lowliness, should cast into Thy treasury its farthing, even as the merchant of our flock, who made increase of his talent of Thy doctrine, and has departed and entered Thy haven.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:5
verses.text: I will speak of the shepherd, under him who has become head of the flock; who was disciple of the Three, and has become our fourth master.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:6
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:7
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has made him our comfort!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:8
verses.text: In one love will I cause them to shine, and as a crown will I weave them, the splendid blossoms, and the fragrant flowers of the teacher and of his disciple, who remained after him as Elisha; for the horn of his election and he was consecrated and became head, and he was exalted and became master.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:9
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:10
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who made him chief!  3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:11
verses.text: And they in heaven rejoiced for the flock, that by the pastor whom they fed, they feed it; the abode of the shepherds under him rejoiced, because they saw the succession of their degrees.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:12
verses.text: He took and set him as a mind in the midst of the great body of the church, and his members came round him to buy of him life, doctrine, new bread.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:13
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:14
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who made him their treasury!  4.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:15
verses.text: He chose him from the multitude of shepherds, because he had given trial of his stedfastness; the time tested him in the midst of the flock, and length of days proved him as a crucible; for that he gave proof in his person, He made him a wall for many.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:16
verses.text: Let thy fasting be armour to our country, thy prayer a shield to our city, let thy censer purchase reconcilement.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:17
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:18
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has hallowed thy sacrifices!  5.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:19
verses.text: The Pastor who has been parted from his flock, fed them on spiritual pastures, and by his exalted staff, he defended them from secret wolves.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:20
verses.text: Fill thou up the room of thy master, which thirsts for the sound of his melody; set up thyself as a pillar, in the city of the trembling people; support her with thy prayers.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:21
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:22
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has made thee our pillar!  6.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:23
verses.text: He has committed the Hand to his disciple, the Throne to one that is worthy of it, the Key to one that is proved faithful, the Flock to one that has excelled.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:24
verses.text: To thy hand belongs the laying-on, to thy offering propitiation, and to thy tongue consolation.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:25
verses.text: May peace adorn thy Dominion; be the watchmen within and the congregations without.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:26
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:27
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has chosen thee for rejoicings!  7.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:28
verses.text: May thy doctrine abound, in deeds more than words! In saying few words, till Thou our land with labour, that by much tillage the scanty seed may become rich, the increase of the old seed, may come among us thirtyfold, and thy new seed sixtyfold.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:29
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:30
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who multiplies an hundredfold!  8.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:31
verses.text: The wrath that was against thee ceases, because peace flows over thee altogether; the jealousy against thee is quenched, for thy love hourly flames forth: thou hast broken the string of envy, that it should smite none in secret; slander that confounds, to it thy ear turns not, for open truth is pleasing to thee.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:32
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:33
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who adorned thy members!  9.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:34
verses.text: Thou shalt give counsel in the midst of thy people, like Jethro among the Hebrews; thou shalt altogether go with him, who for thy profit counsels thee, thou shalt altogether flee from him, who otherwise counsels thee: Rehoboam shall be a sign to thee; thou shalt choose counsels of profit, thou shalt refuse counsels of envy.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:35
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:36
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has counselled comfort!  10.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:37
verses.text: The gift that has been given thee, from on high it flew and came down: thou shalt call it by a name of man, thou shalt not bear it in another power, lest haply to its place there should come, Satan in his guile, supposing, that the sons of men have given it to thee, so that this freeborn gift should serve in bondage to man.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:38
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:39
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has handed down his gift!  11.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:40
verses.text: Thy master is painted in thy person; lo! his likeness is on thee altogether; parted from us one with us is he.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:41
verses.text: In thee we shall see those three, the excellent ones who are parted from us.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:42
verses.text: Thou shalt be unto us a wall as Jacob, and full of tenderness as Babu, and a treasury of speech as Valgesh.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:43
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:44
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who in one has painted them!  12.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:45
verses.text: I, too, the offscouring of the flock, have not withholden aught that was meet: I have painted the similitude of these two, in the colours of these two; that the sheep may see their adornment, and the flock their beauties.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:46
verses.text: And I who have become a lamb endowed with speech, unto Thee, O God of Abraham, in the posture of Abram will give Thee praise.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:47
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 18:48
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has made me His harp!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:1
verses.text: Hymn XVIII.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:3
verses.text: O thou who art made priest after thy master, the illustrious after the excellent, the chaste after the grave, the watchful after the abstinent, thy master from thee has not departed; in the living we see the deceased: for lo! in thee is his likeness painted; and impressed upon thee are his footprints, and all of him shines from all of thee.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:4
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:5
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who in His stead has given us thee!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:6
verses.text: The fruit wherein its tree is painted, bears witness concerning the root.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:7
verses.text: Hitherto there has not failed us, the savour of his sweetness.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:8
verses.text: His words thou showest forth in bodily act, for thou hast fulfilled them in deed.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:9
verses.text: In thy conversation is painted his doctrine, in thy conduct his exposition, in thy fulfilment his interpretation.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:10
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:11
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has made thy lustre to excel!  3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:12
verses.text: The last pastor who was exalted, and became head unto the members, the younger who obtained the birthright, not for price like Jacob, not in jealousy like Aaron, whose brethren the Levites envied him, but by love obtained he it like Moses, though he was older than Aaron.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:13
verses.text: In thee thy brethren rejoiced as in him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:14
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:15
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who chose thee in unanimity!  4.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:16
verses.text: There is no envy or jealousy, among the members of the body; for in love they give ear unto him, with tenderness they are visited by him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:17
verses.text: A watch tower is the head unto the members, for on every side he looks forth.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:18
verses.text: Exalted is he yet meek in his graciousness, even to the feet he humbleth himself, that he may turn away harm from them.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:19
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:20
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who instilled thy love into us!  5.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:21
verses.text: A small thing verily had this been, if by an old man apostasy were overcome.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:22
verses.text: Old age in its prudence submitted; youth in its season conquered; for a youthful combatant endured, the hateful conflict waged, by force that was full of apostacy, which like smoke waxed and passed: with its beginning was its end.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:23
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:24
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who blew upon it that it vanished!  6.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:25
verses.text: The voice of the cornet on a sudden amazed and called Thee to battle.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:26
verses.text: Thou wentest up like a new David, by Thee was subdued a second Goliath.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:27
verses.text: Thou wast not untried in combat, for a secret warfare day by day, Thou art waging against the Evil One.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:28
verses.text: Exercise in secret is wont to attain the crown openly.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:29
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:30
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who chose Thee for our glory!  7.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:31
verses.text: In face of trial Job trained his body and his mind, and in temptation he was victorious.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:32
verses.text: And Joseph conquered in the chamber; Ananias and his company in the furnace, and in the midst of the den Daniel.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:33
verses.text: Satan did foolishly, when in tempting, he confirmed their victory openly.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:34
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:35
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has multiplied shame on him!  8.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:36
verses.text: And the husbandman who apostatized and was urgent, to sow thorns with his left hand; zealous against him was the righteous husbandman, stopped and cut off his left hand.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:37
verses.text: He filled His own right hand and sowed in the heart the words of life; and lo! our understanding is tilled, by His prophets and His apostles.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:38
verses.text: By Thee may our souls be tilled! R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:39
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who chose Thee for our husbandman!  9.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:40
verses.text: And if so be Thy words are too little, till Thou our land with deeds, that amid much tillage, stock and root may be strengthened.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:41
verses.text: Better is a goodly deed, than the hearing of ten thousand words.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:42
verses.text: Thy seed shall yield an hundredfold, and the after crop sixtyfold, yea that which grows of itself thirtyfold.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:43
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:44
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who multiplied Thy increase!  10.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:45
verses.text: That light should be darkened it is not meet, that salt should lose its savour it is not right; defilement for the head is not seemly, nor yet foulness for the mirror.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:46
verses.text: Nor if medicines have lost their savour sicknesses also are not cured; and if so be the torch is quenched, the stumbling also are many.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:47
verses.text: Thy light shall chase away our darkness.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:48
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:49
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who hath made Thee our lamp!  11.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:50
verses.text: Appoint for thee scribes and judges, exactors also and dispensers, overseers also and officers: to each assign his work, lest haply by care should be rusted, or by anxiety should be distracted, the mind and the tongue, wherewith thou offerest supplication, for the expiation of all the people.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:51
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:52
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who makes illustrious Thy ministry!  12.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:53
verses.text: That he should purge his mind, and cleanse also his tongue; that he should purify his hands, and make his whole body to shine; this is too little for the priest and his title, who offers the Living Body.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:54
verses.text: Let him cleanse all himself at all hours; for he stands as mediator, between God and mankind.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:55
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 19:56
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has cleansed His ministers!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:1
verses.text: Hymn XIX.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:3
verses.text: Thou who answerest to the name of Abraham, in that Thou art made father of many; but because to Thee none is spouse, as Sarah was to Abraham,—lo! Thy flock is Thy spouse; bring up her sons in Thy truth; spiritual children may they be to Thee, and the sons be sons of promise, that they may become heirs in Eden.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:4
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:5
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who foreshowed Thee in Abraham!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:6
verses.text: Fair fruit of chastity, in whom the priesthood was well pleased, youngest among Thy brethren as was the son of Jesse; the horn overflowed and anointed Thee, the hand alighted and chose Thee, the Church desired and loved Thee; the pure altar is for Thy ministry, the great throne for Thy honour, and all as one for Thy crown.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:7
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:8
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who multiplied Thy crowning!  3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:9
verses.text: Lo! thy flock, O blessed one, arise and visit it, O diligent one! Jacob ranged the flocks in order; range Thou the sheep that have speech, and enlighten the virgin-youths in purity, and the virgin-maids in chastity; raise up priests in honour, rulers in meekness, and a people in righteousness.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:10
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:11
verses.text: Blessed be He Who filled Thee with understanding!  4.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:12
verses.text: Guard thou the sheep that are whole, and visit them that are sick, and bind up them that are broken, and seek out them that are lost; feed them in the pastures of the Scriptures, and give them drink or the spring of doctrine: let the truth be a wall unto thee, let the cross be a staff unto thee, and truthfulness be peace unto thee.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:13
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:14
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who multiplied Thy virtues!  5.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:15
verses.text: Let there be with Thee in Thy flock, the power that was with David; for if he plucked a straying lamb, from the mouth of the lion, how meet is it for Thee, O exalted one, to be zealous to snatch from the Evil One the souls that are precious above all, for by nothing can they be bought, save by the blood of Christ! R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:16
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who was sold and bought all!  6.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:17
verses.text: Unto Moses Joshua ministered, and for the reward of his ministry, from him received the right hand.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:18
verses.text: Because to an illustrious old man thou hast ministered, he too gave thee the right hand.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:19
verses.text: Moses committed unto Joshua, a flock of which half were wolves; but to thee is delivered a flock, whereof a fourth yea a third is sanctified.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:20
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:21
verses.text: , Blessed be He who adorned thy flock!  7.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:22
verses.text: Let the love of Moses abide in thee, for his love was a discerning love, his zeal a discreet zeal.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:23
verses.text: When Korah and Dathan sundered themselves, he sundered the earth from beneath them; by sundering he made the sundering to cease.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:24
verses.text: In Eldad and Medad he made known, that his good will was altogether this that all the people should prophesy.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:25
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:26
verses.text: , Blessed be He who in His good will was reconciled!  8.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:27
verses.text: The poor estate of Elijah, Elisha loved above wealth; a poor man gave to a poor man, a gift that was great above all.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:28
verses.text: Because thou hast loved the poverty, of thy master who in secret was rich, the fountain of his words shall flow from thee, that thou mayst become a harp for the Spirit, and mayst sing to thyself inwardly His good will.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:29
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:30
verses.text: , Blessed be He who made thee His treasure!  9.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:31
verses.text: There is none that envies thy election, for meek is thy headship; there is none angered by the rebuke, for thy word sows peace; there is none terrified by thy voice, for pleasant in thy visitation; there is none that groans against thy yoke, for it labors instead of our neck, and lightens the burden of our souls.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:32
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:33
verses.text: , Blessed be He who chose thee for our rest  10.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:34
verses.text: Contend not with the mighty, despair not of the outcast; soften and teach the rich, exhort and win the poor; with the harsh join the forbearing, and the long suffering with the wrathful; catch them that are evil by them that are good, and them that spoil by them that give, and the defiled by means of the sanctified.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:35
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:36
verses.text: , Blessed be He who made thee our hunter!  11.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:37
verses.text: Take to thee ten thousand medicaments, and arise and go forth among the sick; to the diseased offer medicine, and to him that is sound a preservative; not one medicine only shalt thou offer, for the sickness lest haply it be not meet: offer many remedies, that the sickness may find healing; likewise thou shalt learn experience.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:38
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:39
verses.text: , Blessed be He who laboured to heal our wounds!  12.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:40
verses.text: May the land be according to thy desire; may the vineyard be according to thy husbandry; may the flock be in the midst of thy dwelling, and the sheep sound under thy staff! Mayest thou be a great Head, and we the jewels of thy crown! May we be beautiful in thee and thou be beautiful in us! for they are goodly each in the other, people and priest when they are at one.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:41
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:42
verses.text: , Blessed be He who has sowed among us unity!  13.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:43
verses.text: Hearken to the Apostle when he saith, to that virgin whom he had espoused; I am jealous over you with jealousy, with a jealousy verily of God, not of the flesh but of the spirit.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:44
verses.text: Be jealous therewith thou also in pureness, that He may know what she is and whose she is.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:45
verses.text: In thee may she cherish, and in thee may she love, Jesus the Bridegroom in truth.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:46
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:47
verses.text: , Blessed is he whose zeal is holy!  14.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:48
verses.text: As are her masters, so are her manners: for with the teacher that lags a laggard is she, and with him that is noble, excellent is she.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:49
verses.text: The Church is like unto a mirror, for according to the face that gazes into it, thus does it put on the likeness thereof.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:50
verses.text: For as is the king so also his host, and as is the priest so also his flock; according as these are it is stamped on them.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:51
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:52
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who stamped her in His likeness!  15.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:53
verses.text: Without a testament they departed, those three illustrious priests; who in Testaments used to meditate, those two Testaments of God.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:54
verses.text: Great gain have they bequeathed to us, even this example of poverty.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:55
verses.text: They who possessed nothing the blessed ones, made us their possessions; the Church was their treasure.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:56
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:57
verses.text: , Blessed is he who possessed in them his possessions!  16.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:58
verses.text: The priest Jacob the noble, with him she was ennobled as he was: because he joined his love to his jealousy, with fear and love he was clothed.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:59
verses.text: With Babes a lover of bounty, for money she redeemed the captives.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:60
verses.text: With Valgesh a scribe of the law, her heart she opened to the Scriptures.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:61
verses.text: With thee then may her profit be manifold! R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 20:62
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has magnified her merchantmen!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:1
verses.text: Hymn XX.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:3
verses.text: O virgin-youth that art become bridegroom, move to a little jealousy thy mind, towards her who is the wife of thy youth: cut off the attachments which she had, in her girlhood with many others; rebuke her and call together her affections, that she may know what she is and whose she is.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:4
verses.text: In thee may she desire yea love, Christ the Bridegroom of truth.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:5
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:6
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who betrothes her to His Only Begotten!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:7
verses.text: Be jealous O husbandman against the tares, which have sprung up and entangled themselves among the wheat.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:8
verses.text: Easy is it to root up the thicket, rather than the despised: if a slight breeze bears it, it attacks the sowing and conquers it.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:9
verses.text: That which three husbandmen have sown, may it return in threefold measure! thirty-fold and sixty and an hundred! R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:10
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who makes rich thine increase!  3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:11
verses.text: A new shepherd for him it is right, that he should oversee the flock in new wise, and should know what is the number of it, and should see what are its needs.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:12
verses.text: A flock it is that was purchased with the blood, of that chief of the shepherds.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:13
verses.text: Call thou and cause to pass each sheep by its name, for it is a flock whereof the name is written, and its reckoning in the Book of life.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:14
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:15
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who will require the number thereof!  4.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:16
verses.text: Lo the spouse of thy Lord is with thee! keep her from all harm, and from men that deal corruptly, and call the congregations by their own names.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:17
verses.text: The name of her spouse is set on her; let her not go a whoring for another name, for she was not baptized in the name of man; with Names wherein she was baptized let her make confession, of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:18
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:19
verses.text: , Blessed be He by Whose Name she is called!  5.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:20
verses.text: The Apostle her betrother was jealous over her, that she should not be corrupted by names, yet not by names that were false, but not even by names that were true; not by Cephas yea not by his name.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:21
verses.text: They who were true betrothers, set the Name of her betrothed upon her; the false betrothers like whoremongers, set their own names on the flock.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:22
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:23
verses.text: , Glory be to Thy Name, our Creator!  6.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:24
verses.text: The stamp on living creatures, O my brethren, no man destroys openly; and a name that is signed to a letter, no man adds to or alters: whoso effaces the stamp is a thief; and whoso alters the name is a falsifier.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:25
verses.text: The name of Christ has been altered; names of falsehood lo! have been set, upon the congregations that have been corrupted.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:26
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:27
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has called His flock by His Name!  7.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:28
verses.text: Look at the Prophets and Apostles, how like they are each to the other! By the Prophets the Name of God, was set on the flock of God; and by the Apostles the Name of Christ, was set on the Church of Christ.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:29
verses.text: The false betrothers also are like one another for by their names are called, the congregations who commit whoredom with them.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:30
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 21:31
verses.text: , Blessed be He in Whose Name we were sanctified!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:1
verses.text: Hymn XXI.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:3
verses.text: John who was a torch, laid bare and rebuked the wanton ones: they made haste and quenched the torch, that they might let loose the desire of their lust.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:4
verses.text: Be thou a lamp in brightness, and make the works of darkness cease, that whensoever thy doctrine shines, no man may dare at its rising, to give ear to the lusts of darkness.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:5
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:6
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who made thee our lamp!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:7
verses.text: A great blessing was hidden in it, even in the reproof of Elijah.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:8
verses.text: Elisha ministered unto him and sought, a twofold reward of his ministration.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:9
verses.text: Twofold glory it gave to him, for in double measure was he clad with his virtues.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:10
verses.text: Thou who hast loved the reproof of Valgesh thy master rich in gifts, mayest thou inherit the treasure of his wisdom! R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:11
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who makes thy Doctrine rich!  3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:12
verses.text: May greediness be overcome by thy fasting even as by the fasting of Daniel! May lust be confounded before thy body, like as it was confounded before Joseph! May lust of money be overcome by thee! like as it was overcome before Simeon, Mayest thou bind on earth even as he, and loose on high after his likeness; for thy faith is even as his! R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:13
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who committed to thee His ministry!  4.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:14
verses.text: Thy chastity be as Elisha's, and thy celibacy Elijah's, the covenant with thine eyes as Job's, thy tender mercies as David's; without envy as Jonathan, thy firmness as Jeremiah's, thy gentleness the Apostles'! Thine be the ancient things of the prophets, thine the new things of the Apostles.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:15
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:16
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who filled thee with their treasures!  5.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:17
verses.text: Be a crown to the priesthood, and in thee be the ministry made to shine! Be a brother to the elders, likewise an overseer to the deacons; be a master to youth, a staff and a hand to old age; be a wall to the consecrated virgins.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:18
verses.text: In thy conversation may the covenant prevail, and the Church in thy comeliness be adorned.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:19
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:20
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who chose thee to be priest!  6.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:21
verses.text: In thy poverty be brought to nought, the hateful custom of the house of Gehazi; in thy sanctity be abolished, the abominable custom of the house of Eli; in thy unity be done away, the treacherous greeting of the lips of Iscariot the deceiver! Pour forth all our thought, and form it anew from the beginning! R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:22
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who in thy crucible refines us!  7.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:23
verses.text: In thy conversation let Mammon be put to shame, who has been lord over our freedom! Let the disease be done away from us, which is customary with us and pleasant to us; abolish the causes that have maintained, customs that are full of harm! Evil things have possessed us through custom: let good things possess us through custom! Be thou, O Lord, the cause of help to us.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:24
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:25
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who chose Thee in order to our life!  8.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:26
verses.text: Let evil customs be cut off: let not the Church possess wealth; that she be sufficed let her possess souls, and if thus she be sufficed let it be in marvellous measure! And let not her deceased be buried in the cutting off of hope heathenishly, with vestments and wailing and lamentation; for the living is clothed in raiment, but the deceased his all is a coffin.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:27
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:28
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who to our dust turns us again!  9.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:29
verses.text: A cause of evil is the lust, also the greediness of the house of Eli, and the thievishness of the house of Gehazi, and the reviling of Nabal.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:30
verses.text: These hateful well-springs close thou up, lest there be a great outpouring, and there come from it defilement, and even thou be reached by its overflow.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:31
verses.text: The Lord restrain their outpourings! R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:32
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who dried up their over-flowings!  10.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:33
verses.text: For the old man commit speech to him; for the young enjoin silence on him; for the stranger who comes in unto thee, learns of thee from thy discipline, namely who speaks first, and who second and third: and if every man keeps his mouth, and every man knows his degree, they will call thee happy.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:34
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:35
verses.text: , Our Lord perform thy desire!  11.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:36
verses.text: Let the voice of thy truth be single and thy assumed voices without number; the image of truthfulness on thy heart, and on thy face all aspects, sadness, gladness, and feebleness.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:37
verses.text: To him that errs show that thou art wrathful, to him that is chaste show that thou art glad.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:38
verses.text: Be single towards the Godhead, and to mankind be manifold.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:39
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:40
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who with all men is all things!  12.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:41
verses.text: If thou hearest an evil report, from truthful men that deceive not, pour forth tears that thou mayst quench the fire that burns in others; let them that are wise pray with thee, and appoint thou a fast for them that have knowledge, and let thy dwelling be in mourning, for him who is lost in sin, that he may turn back in repentance.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:42
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:43
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who found the sheep that was lost!  13.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:44
verses.text: To every man give not thy ear, lest liars overwhelm thee; to every man lend not thy foot, lest vile ones misguide thee; to every man give not thy soul, lest the insolent trample thee.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:45
verses.text: Keep thy hand from the false man, lest he gather thorns into thy hand.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:46
verses.text: Be far off and near at hand.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:47
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:48
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who is near though far!  14.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:49
verses.text: Lo the fame of the new king, resounds and comes into the world! To the spoiled he is a comfort, and to the spoilers a terror.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:50
verses.text: On the covetous vomiting has come, that they may render up all that they have swallowed.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:51
verses.text: Let them be put to fear from before thee also, that between a priest and a righteous king, the former customs may be done away.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:52
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:53
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who was angry, and turns and has mercy!  15.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:54
verses.text: There is that finds opportunity and ventures, and there is that forces and compels his will.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:55
verses.text: One thinks that judgment is reserved, and another that it is not to be at all.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:56
verses.text: There is that steals and quenches his thirst, and there is that steals and thirsts to steal.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:57
verses.text: The rich steal and the poor; but the hungry steal by measure, and the full steal without measure.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:58
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:59
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has searched out all wills!  16.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:60
verses.text: But now has He given opportunity, and every man has shown his will, of what kind it is and to what it is like, and what he has chosen for himself rather than what.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:61
verses.text: He has removed temptation from every man, lest even he who is not hateful should deny him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:62
verses.text: He has given us opportunity that we may understand, that better think this power is chastisement which profits much.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:63
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:64
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who for our profit rebukes us!  17.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:65
verses.text: For He wills not by compulsion, to cast his yoke on our neck; He gave us opportunity and we waxed proud, that so when we rebelled and were punished, we might love His light yoke, might choose His pleasant staff.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:66
verses.text: Our rest is very wearisome to us, for in His compulsion is restfulness, and in His yoke is lightening.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:67
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:68
verses.text: , Blessed be He Whose labour is pleasantness!  18.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:69
verses.text: The whole world like a body, had fallen into a heavy sickness; for in the fever of heathenism, it burned and pined and fell.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:70
verses.text: The right hand of tender mercy touched it, and dealt with its soul in pity; and cut off speedily its heathenism, for that was the cause of its sickness, and it was purged and sweated and restored.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:71
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:72
verses.text: , Glory be to the Hand that has healed!  19.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:73
verses.text: The land shall have peace in thy days, for it has seen thee that thou art full of peace.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:74
verses.text: In thee shall the churches be built, and shall be clothed with their ornaments, and their books shall be opened in them, and their tables shall be spread, and their ministers shall be adorned; from them shall go up thanksgiving, as first fruits to the Lord of peace.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:75
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:76
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who revives our Churches!  20.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:77
verses.text: Let thy prayer go up to heaven, with it let reconciliation go up! May the Lord of Heaven rain down His blessings upon our [ ], and His consolations upon our afflictions, and His gathering upon our dispersion: may He waken His jealousy with His love; may His righteousness avenge our disgrace, may His grace blot out our iniquity! R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:78
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who blesses His flock!  21.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:79
verses.text: The first priest and first king, even as if depicted each in the other, were balanced as if in scales.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:80
verses.text: So too Valgesh and so too the son of that king, for they were gentle and calm.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:81
verses.text: May these latter be like each to other; the priests be shining lights, the king be glowing lights, likewise illustrious judges! R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:82
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has enlightened our souls!  22.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:83
verses.text: From the king's office laws, and from the priest's office propitiations.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:84
verses.text: That both should be mild is hateful; that both should be strong is grievous.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:85
verses.text: Let one be strong and one be tender; in prudence and in discretion, let fear with mercy be mingled.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:86
verses.text: Let our priesthood be tender, likewise our king strong.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:87
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:88
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has mingled our helps!  23.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:89
verses.text: Let the priests pray for the kings, that they may be a wall to mankind! From beside the kings be victory; and from beside the priests faith! May victory save our bodies, and faith our souls! May kings put an end to war; priests put an end to strife! May disputing and quarrelling cease! R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:90
verses.text: , Blessed be the Son of Him Who gives peace to all! Praise to Thee for Thy gift!      [XXII.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:91
verses.text: –XXV.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:92
verses.text: (wanting); XXVI.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:93
verses.text: (only a fragment remains); XXVII.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:94
verses.text: –XXXIV.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 22:95
verses.text: (relate to Edessa and Carrhae).

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:1
verses.text: Hymn XXXV.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:2
verses.text: Concerning Our Lord, and Concerning Death and Satan.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:4
verses.text: The Voice made proclamation: and they gathered and came; the hosts of the Evil One, together with his ministers.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:5
verses.text: The army of the tares was gathered altogether, for they saw that Jesus had triumphed, to the grief of all them on the left hand, for there was none of them but had been tormented.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:6
verses.text: They began one by one to relate all whatsoever they had endured.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:7
verses.text: Sin and Hell were terrified: Death trembled and the dead rebelled; and Satan because sinners rebelled against him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:8
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:9
verses.text: , To Thee be glory because the Evil One saw Thee and was troubled!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:10
verses.text: Sin cried aloud; she gave counsel to her sons, to the demons and the devils, and unto them she said, Legion the head of your ranks is not, the sea has swallowed him and his company; and likewise ye my sons if ye despise, this Jesus will destroy you.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:11
verses.text: Ye who in a snare took Solomon, it is therefore a reproach to you, that ye should be overcome by his disciples, takers of fish and ignorant men; for lo! they have taken the draught of men, which had been taken by us.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:13
verses.text: This is great, above all evils (saith the Evil One, concerning our Saviour); for this suffices Him not that He has spoiled us, but likewise on us He has begun retribution for Jonah son of Amittai.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:14
verses.text: On Legion therefore He was avenging him when He seized and cast him into the sea.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:15
verses.text: Jonah emerged, after three days and came up; but Legion yea not after a long season, for the depth of the sea closed upon him at the command.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:17
verses.text: I tempted Him, after his past, with pleasant bread, but He desired it not.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:18
verses.text: To my grief I strove to learn a psalm, that by His psalm I might take Him as a prey: I paused and learned it a second time, but He made my second trial to be vain.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:19
verses.text: I brought Him up to a mountain and showed Him all possessions; I gave them to Him and He was not moved.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:20
verses.text: Better was it for me in the days of Adam, who gave me no great trouble in teaching him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:22
verses.text: The Evil One ceased, from his activity and said, A cause of idleness to me, is this Jesus; for lo! the publicans and harlots take refuge in Him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:23
verses.text: What work shall I seek for myself? I who was master to all men, to whom shall I be a disciple? Sin again said, It must be, that I forsake, therefore, and change from that which I am; for this Son of Mary who is come, as a new creation, has created mankind.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:25
verses.text: Gluttonous Death, lamented and said, I have learned fasting, which I used not to know; lo! Jesus gathers multitudes, but as to me, in His feast a fast is proclaimed for me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:26
verses.text: One man has closed my mouth, mine who have closed the mouths of many.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:27
verses.text: Hell said I will restrain my greed; hunger, therefore, is mine: this Man triumphs as at the marriage, when He changed the water into wine, so He changes the vesture of the dead into life.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:29
verses.text: And moreover, God made a flood, and washed the earth, and purged her crimes; fire and brimstone again He sent on her, that He might make white her stains.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:30
verses.text: By fire He gave me the Sodomites, and by flood the Giants.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:31
verses.text: He closed the mouth of the hosts of Sennacherib, and opened the mouth of Hell.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:32
verses.text: These things and such as these, I loved.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:33
verses.text: But now, in place of deadly visitations of justice, He has wrought in His Son, the quickening of the dead by grace.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:35
verses.text: Prophets and righteous men, said the Evil One, unto his companions, have been seen by me; and though their strength was exceeding mighty, there was in them a savour of that which is mine; for the stuff whereof the sons of man are made, is near akin to our heaven.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:36
verses.text: This man has clothed Himself with the body of Adam, and is troubling us, for our leaven has no power on Him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:37
verses.text: He is man, therefore, and God; for His manhood in His Godhead is intermingled.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:39
verses.text: Adam was seen by me, that fountain from whence flowed all races of men; his children has been sought out by me, and proved one by one.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:40
verses.text: Yet have I not seen from the beginning a man, of whom one part was of God, and the other half, man.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:41
verses.text: Moses, who shone in his splendour, I tempted again, and in his tongue I made him to err; but this man, yea, not in His mind, for pure exceedingly is the fountain of His thoughts.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:43
verses.text: The lust of the body, is in all bodies; for even while they sleep, it wakes in them.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:44
verses.text: Him, who in his waking hours keeps himself pure, by means of a dream, I disturb.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:45
verses.text: The dregs of the body are stirred in him, by a shaking movement in secret inwardly.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:46
verses.text: The sleeping and the waking besides, I trouble alike.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:47
verses.text: This is He Who alone keeps Himself pure, Whom not even in a dream can I disturb, Who even in His sleep is pure and holy.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:49
verses.text: But separate was even His childhood, from that of the children who have been seen by me; for I have not seen in Him any part of that which is of me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:50
verses.text: I was afraid of His childhood; therefore, I stirred up Herod, that among the infants He might be slain.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:51
verses.text: Because of this also that He escaped, I was greatly afraid, for our mystery how did He find out! He received the offerings of the Wise Men; He scorned us and departed and escaped from our sword.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:53
verses.text: Children have been seen by me, sons of righteous men; yea, also youths, sons of chaste women; and I have moved them from the womb, one by one, and I have seen in them our leaven.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:54
verses.text: For they were wrathful men and revilers, yea, also furious and gluttonous; fruits were they that by instruction were to be ripened and sweetened.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:55
verses.text: But this man from His first planting, was a good fruit that possessed sweetness, wherewith sinners were made sweet.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:57
verses.text: Even while He was an infant, He was a teacher of the sons of men, by the splendour that was upon Him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:58
verses.text: Even the priest as he carried Him was amazed at Him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:59
verses.text: In the prudence of old men was He clad.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:60
verses.text: Joseph stood aloof from Him: His mother gloried in His presence.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:61
verses.text: He was a help in His childhood, to every one that saw Him; He was a profit to them that knew Him from the day when He entered into the world, He was a helper of mankind by His excellencies.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:63
verses.text: From whence has it sprung up before me, this fruit of Mary, the grape whereof the wine is not according to nature? For lo! I stand between doubts.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:64
verses.text: To turn away and leave Him, I am afraid, lest by His teaching, they should be sweetened, they, who have acquired by bitterness.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:65
verses.text: But again to tread on Him and crush Him, is a terror to me, lest haply He turn and become new wine unto sinners, and when they are drunken therewith, lo! they forget their idols.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:67
verses.text: Lo! I am afraid of both things, as well His death, as also His life.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:68
verses.text: Then unto the Evil One His ministers made answer and counselled Him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:69
verses.text: Though both these things be grievous, somewhat lighter to us is the trouble, that we should choose His death rather than his life.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:70
verses.text: Let Death tell us whether any one from among the righteous, has ever from the first been aroused again.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:71
verses.text: The sons of the Giants and the renowned ones, there is none that has issued forth from her, even Hell, the Devourer.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:73
verses.text: The blowing of the wind, a man may feel after; but the Son of Mary, who shall search him out? for when He wept, by His tears He robbed me; and again when I bid Him cast Himself, from the holy Temple, I thought, that it was through fear He cast Himself not: yet when they threw Him from the hill-top, He flew through the air.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:74
verses.text: On the well again when He was weary He sat.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:75
verses.text: His variableness I understand not, for on the dry land alike and on the water He walks.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:77
verses.text: I have seen Him that He hungered, as a Son of man; yet this was done away by the bread which He multiplied.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:78
verses.text: From the beginning I proved Him and I came to Him; He questioned me as though He knew me not; but this, too, was done away, when He showed that He knew our secrets.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:79
verses.text: Again He chose Iscariot, as though He knew him not; then He turned and showed that He knew him, though he was binding and loosing.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:80
verses.text: I was mistaken in Him, for He was baptized and emerged and overwhelmed me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:82
verses.text: But one token there is which I have seen in Him that heartens me exceedingly above all.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:83
verses.text: For while He was praying I saw Him and was glad, because He changed colour and was afraid: His sweat was as drops of blood, because He felt that His day was come.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:84
verses.text: This is pleasant to me, exceedingly above all, if it be not that deceiving He has deceived me therein.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:85
verses.text: But if beguiling He has beguiled me, this is both for me and for you alike, my ministers.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:87
verses.text: Then shouted the host of devils and said, Hateful is the sign that we see in thee, for never from the beginning has it thus happened to thee.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:88
verses.text: In prompt counsels thou wast excellent: the Son of Mary captures our cities, while thou art prolonging thy discourse.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:89
verses.text: Arise, go forth, let us fight with Him, for this were to us a reproach, that we being many should be overcome by one.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:90
verses.text: And if thou art in pain or fear, give us counsel for the battle and stay thou behind.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:92
verses.text: This Jesus out of His own words it is, that I shall teach Him, and war with Him; for He said that he, even Satan, is divided, himself against himself, and that he cannot stand.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:93
verses.text: Though He desires to fight with us, He has given us arms which are against Himself, gage and divide for me His disciples, for if ye divide them, with these you will conquer them, even with Eve and the serpent, the weak powers, whereby I conquered the first Adam.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:95
verses.text: Death unto the Evil One, made answer and said to him, Wherefore tarriest thou not according to thy wont? for lo! it is those that are despised and least, that thou ensnarest after thy custom: Jesus Who is great above all, wherewith hast thou sought to ensnare Him? The experience of His weapons moves thee to fear, which He hurled against thee when he was tempted of thee.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:96
verses.text: Thou and I with thy followers, the host of us is too little for the battle with Him, the Son of Mary.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:98
verses.text: I counsel, then, if this our strife permits us to do anything: go thou into that disciple, let thyself loose, that head may speak with heads; and let loose all thy host, let it go and stir up the Pharisees.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:99
verses.text: And beware, lest thou speak contentiously as thou art wont.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 23:100
verses.text: If thou be a god, descend from hence, with fondness kiss them and betray Him; and, lo! we will bring on Him the envy and the sword of the Levites.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:1
verses.text: Hymn XXXVI.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:3
verses.text: Our Lord subdued His might and constrained it, that His living death might give life to Adam.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:4
verses.text: His hands He gave to the piercing of the nails, instead of the hand that plucked the fruit: He was smitten on the cheek in the judgment hall, instead of the mouth that ate it in Eden.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:5
verses.text: And because his foot bore Adam thence, His feet were pierced.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:6
verses.text: Our Lord was stripped, that He might make us modest: with the gall and vinegar He made sweet the bitterness of the serpent, which he had poured forth into mankind.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:7
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:8
verses.text: Blessed is He Who gave me the victory and quickened the dead to His glory!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:9
verses.text: (Death.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:10
verses.text: )—If Thou be God show Thy power; and if Thou be man, feel our power.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:11
verses.text: And if it be Adam that Thou seekest, get Thee hence! because of his transgressions he is shut up here; Cherubim and Seraphim await not, in his stead to pay his debt.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:12
verses.text: There is none among them mortal, so as to give his life in his stead.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:13
verses.text: Who can open the mouth of hell, and plunge and bring him up from her, who has swallowed him and keeps a hold on him, and that forever!  3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:14
verses.text: I am He who has conquered all the wise men; and lo! in the corners they are heaped for me in hell.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:15
verses.text: Come, enter, son of Joseph, and see terrible things; the limbs of the giants, the mighty corpse of Samson, and the skeleton of the stubborn Goliath; Og, moreover, the son of the giants, who made for himself a bed of iron and lay thereon, from whence I hurled him and cast him down; that cedar I laid low to the gate of hell.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:17
verses.text: I by myself alone have conquered multitudes, and one may single-handed seek to conquer me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:18
verses.text: Prophets and priests and men of renown have I carried off; I have conquered kings in their armies, and mighty men in their hunts, and righteous men in their excellencies.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:19
verses.text: Streams of corpses are hurled by me into hell, and though they pour into her she is athirst.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:20
verses.text: Though one be near or though he be far off, the end brings him to the gate of hell.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:22
verses.text: Silver I despised at the hand of the rich, and their offerings corrupted me not.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:23
verses.text: The lords of slaves never once persuaded me, to take a slave instead of his lord, and a poor man instead of a rich man, or an old man instead of a child.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:24
verses.text: As for wise that are able to charm wild beasts, their charms enter not into my ears.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:25
verses.text: Hater of persuasion all men call me; and I the thing that is commanded me that I do.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:27
verses.text: Who is this, or whose son is He, or what His lineage who has conquered me? The book of families is by me; lo! I went in and read and studied the names from Adam till now, and not one of the dead do I forget.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:28
verses.text: Family by family, lo! they are written, upon my limbs.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:29
verses.text: Because of Thee, O Jesus, I went in and made a reckoning, that I might show Thee that there is none that escapeth my hands.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:31
verses.text: Yet were there two men (that I lie not) whose names have escaped me in Hell.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:32
verses.text: For Enoch and Elijah came not to me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:33
verses.text: In all the world I have sought them; yea thither where Jonah descended, I descended and sought and they were not.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:34
verses.text: And though I suppose that into Paradise, they have entered and escaped, a mighty Cherub guards it.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:35
verses.text: The ladder Jacob saw, what if haply by it they have entered into Heaven!  8.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:36
verses.text: Who is there that has measured the sand of the sea, and has spilt only two grains? This harvest wherein every day there labour, diseases as harvesters, I alone carry the handfuls and gather them up; other gatherers in making haste, drop handfuls.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:37
verses.text: Vintagers overlook clusters; but two grapes have escaped me, in that great vintage which I alone have plucked.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:39
verses.text: I am He that has taken (said Death), on sea and on dry land, all prey in chase.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:40
verses.text: Eagles of the air come to me; yea and dragons of the deep: creeping things and fowl and cattle; old men, youths and children.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:41
verses.text: These will convince Thee, O Son of Mary, that this my power rules over all.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:42
verses.text: Thy Cross how shall it conquer me, who by a tree lo! I have prevailed and conquered from old time?  10.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:43
verses.text: But I was desirous to speak yet farther, for I am not wanting in words; yea words are not to be sought by me, for lo! deeds call on me close at hand.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:44
verses.text: Not as you do I make promise, to the simple of secret things, that forsooth there is to be a resurrection at some time or other.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:45
verses.text: If then Thou art very powerful, give a present pledge, that Thy distant promise also may be believed.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:47
verses.text: Death ended his speech of derision: and the voice of our Lord sounded into Hell, and He cried aloud and burst the graves one by one.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:48
verses.text: Tremblings took hold on Death; Hell that never of old had been lighted up, into it there flashed splendours, from the Watchers who entered in and brought out the dead to meet Him, who was dead and gives life to all.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:49
verses.text: The dead came forth, and the living were ashamed, they who thought that they had conquered the Life Giver of all.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:51
verses.text: But who gave me the day of Moses, (said Death) who made a feast for me? For that lamb that was slain in Egypt gave me, from every house the first fruit: heaps and heaps of the first born, at the gate of Hell he piled me them.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:52
verses.text: But this Lamb of the festival, has robbed Hell; of the dead He has taken title and carried them off from me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:53
verses.text: That lamb filled the graves for me; but this has emptied the graves that were full.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:55
verses.text: The death of Jesus to me is a torment; I prefer for myself His life rather than His death.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:56
verses.text: This is the Dead whose death (lo!) is hateful to me; in the death of all men else I rejoice, but His Death, even His, I detest; that He may come back to life I hope.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:57
verses.text: While He was living He brought to life and restored three that were dead; but now by His death, at the gate of Hell they have trampled on me, the dead who have come to life, whom I was going to shut in.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:59
verses.text: I will haste and will close the gates of Hell, before this Dead, Whose death has spoiled me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:60
verses.text: Whoso hears will wonder at my humiliation, that by a dead man who is without I am overcome.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:61
verses.text: All the dead seek to go forth, but this one presses to enter in.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:62
verses.text: A medicine of life has entered into Hell, and has restored life to its dead.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:63
verses.text: Who then has brought in and hidden from me, that living fire wherein have reposed, the cold and dark recesses of Hell?  15.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:64
verses.text: Death has seen the Watchers in Hell; the immortal instead of the mortal; and he said Confusion has entered our abode, for in these two things is torment to me: That the dead have come forth out of Hell, and the Watchers that die not have entered therein.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:65
verses.text: Lo! one at the pillow in this tomb, has entered and sat down by it, and a second his companion at His feet.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:66
verses.text: I will entreat of Him and will persuade Him, with His pledge to ascend and go to His Kingdom.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:68
verses.text: Be not wroth against me, gracious Jesus, for the words that my pride has spoken before Thee! Who is there that when seeing Thy Cross, shall have doubted that Thou art man? Who is there that shall have seen Thy Power, and shall not believe that Thou art also God? Lo! thus by these two things I have learnt to confess that Thou art man and likewise art God! For as much as the dead in Hell repent not, go up among the living, O Lord, and preach repentance.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:70
verses.text: O Jesus King, receive my supplication, and with my supplication take to Thyself a pledge, even Adam the great pledge accept for Thyself, him in whom are buried all the dead; even as when I received him, in him were hidden all the living.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:71
verses.text: The first pledge I have given Thee, the body of Adam; go Thou up therefore and reign over all; and when I shall hear Thy trumpet, I with mine own hand will lead forth the dead at Thy Coming.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:73
verses.text: Our King living has gone forth and gone up, out of Hell, as Conqueror.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:74
verses.text: Woe He has doubled to them that are of the left hand; to evil spirits and demons He is sorrow, to Satan and to Death He is pain, to Sin and Hell mourning.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:75
verses.text: Joy to them that are of the right hand, has come to-day.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 24:76
verses.text: On this great day therefore, great glory let us give to Him, who died and is alive that, unto all He may, give life and resurrection!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:1
verses.text: Hymn XXXVII.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:3
verses.text: Death was weeping for her, even for Sheol, when he saw her treasury that it was emptied.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:4
verses.text: And he said, Who, then, has plundered thy riches? Gehazi stole and was discovered; I am stealing every day, but theft has not been laid to my charge.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:5
verses.text: I am sent to Kings, in their sicknesses, their guards are set around them, guards are also at their gate.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:6
verses.text: The soul of kings I snatch and I go forth.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:7
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:8
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who has broken the sting of Death by His Cross!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:9
verses.text: All women grieve that are barren; Sheol rejoices because of her barrenness; she is desolate if so be that she brings forth.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:10
verses.text: The all-compelling Power constrained it, even the bosom that was barren and cold, and it rendered back though wont to deny its debts.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:11
verses.text: Rebekah, when the two babes afflicted her, asked for death.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:12
verses.text: How great then the pain of Sheol, when there smote her strange pangs; the dead were roused and brake forth and came out from her bowels.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:14
verses.text: Is this then perchance that saying, which was heard by me from Isaiah? (but I despised it) when he arose and said, "Who hath heard such a thing as this? that the earth should travail in one day, and bring forth a nation in one hour".

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:15
verses.text: Is it this that has come to pass? or else, is it reserved for us hereafter? And if it be this it is a vain shadow that I thought I am a king; I knew not it was but a deposit I was keeping.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:17
verses.text: Two utterances that were different, have I heard from him, even this Isaiah.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:18
verses.text: For he said that a virgin should conceive and bring forth; and he said again that the earth should bring forth.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:19
verses.text: But lo! the Virgin has brought Him forth, and Sheol the barren has brought Him forth; two wombs that contrary to nature, have been changed by Him; the Virgin and Sheol both of them.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:20
verses.text: The Virgin in her bringing forth He made glad; but Sheol He grieved and made sad in His Resurrection.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:22
verses.text: I saw in the valley that Ezekiel, who quickened the dead when he was questioned; and I saw the bones that were in heaps and they moved.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:23
verses.text: There was a tumult of bones in Sheol, bone seeking for his fellow, and joint for her mate.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:24
verses.text: There was there none that questioned, or that was questioned, whether those bones lived.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:25
verses.text: Unquestioned, the voice of Jesus, the Master of all creatures quickened them.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:27
verses.text: Sheol was made sorrowful when she saw them, even the sorrowful dead made to rejoice.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:28
verses.text: She wept for Lazarus when he went forth, "Go in peace thou dead that livest, bewailed by two houses of mourning".

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:29
verses.text: Within and without were lamentations for him; for his sisters wept for him when he came into the grave unto me, and I wept for him as he went forth.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:30
verses.text: In his death there was weeping among the living; likewise in Sheol is great mourning at his resurrection.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:32
verses.text: Now it is that I have tasted the taste of his sorrow, even of him who weeps over his beloved.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:33
verses.text: The dead that are thus beloved of Sheol, how dear were they to their fathers! The limbs which I severed and carried away, lo! they are shorn away and carried off from me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:34
verses.text: If I thus suffer for the departure of him, the youth who was restored to life, blessed is He Who had compassion on the widow; in her only son He gave peace to her dwelling that had been made desolate.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:36
verses.text: Lo! this suffering which I cause men to suffer in their beloved ones, in the end on me it gathers itself altogether.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:37
verses.text: For when the dead shall have left Sheol, for every man there will be resurrection, and for me alone torment.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:38
verses.text: And who is he then that shall bear for me all these things, that I shall see Sheol left alone, because this voice which has rent the graves, makes her desolate and sends forth the dead that were in her midst?  9.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:39
verses.text: If a man reads in the Prophets, he hears there of righteous wars.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:40
verses.text: But if a man meditate in the story of Jesus, he learns of grace and tender mercy.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:41
verses.text: And if a man think of Jesus, that He is a strange God it is a reproach against me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:42
verses.text: No other strange key into the gate of Sheol could ever be fitted.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:43
verses.text: One is the key of the Creator, that which has opened it, yea, is to open it at His Coming.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:45
verses.text: Who is he that is able to join the bones, save that Power which created them? What is it that shall reunite the shreds of the body, save the hand of the Maker? What is it that shall restore the forms, save the finger of the Creator? He, who created and turned and destroyed, is He that is able also to renew and raise up.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:46
verses.text: Another God is unable to enter in and restore creatures not his own.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:48
verses.text: But were he another Power, I should be very joyful that He is coming to me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:49
verses.text: Into the bosom of Sheol He would descend and learn that One alone is God.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:50
verses.text: Mortals that have erred and preached that there are Gods many, lo! they are bound for me in Sheol, and their Gods have never grieved because of them.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 25:51
verses.text: One God do I know, and His Prophets and His Apostles do I acknowledge.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:1
verses.text: Hymn XXXVIII.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:3
verses.text: My throne was set for me in Sheol: and one arose that was dead, and hurled me from it.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:4
