verses.text: Every man feared me alone, and I feared no man.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:5
verses.text: Terror and trouble were among the living, rest and peace among the dead.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:6
verses.text: In a man that was slain lo! there has entered into Sheol He that takes her captive.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:7
verses.text: I used to take all men captive: the Son of Captivity Whom I took captive has taken me captive.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:8
verses.text: He Whom I took captive has led her away and is gone to Paradise.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:9
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:10
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who has quickened the dead of Sheol by His Cross!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:11
verses.text: All men complain much against me; and I against one only have complained.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:12
verses.text: Who is there among men so just as I? Has corruption touched my integrity? I held all men in affection, and whoso hates me knows it; I know not all my days what a bribe is.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:13
verses.text: The person of a king have I not accepted.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:14
verses.text: By me is preached equality, for bondman and his lord in Sheol I make equal.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:16
verses.text: Before God it is that I minister, with Whom is no acceptance of persons.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:17
verses.text: What other is there that endures as I do, I that am cursed when I do good? Perversely are requited to me the benefits I have rendered.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:18
verses.text: Though my deeds are goodly, my name is not goodly.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:19
verses.text: Yet my mind rests in its integrity: in God it is that I comfort myself; for though He is good He is denied every day and endures it.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:21
verses.text: The old I remove from all sufferings, likewise the young from all sins.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:22
verses.text: Secret contention I quell in Sheol; in our land there is no iniquity: it is Sheol and Heaven alone, that are removed from all sins; this earth that lies between, in her iniquity dwells.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:23
verses.text: He therefore that is prudent will either go up into Heaven, or, if that be too hard, will go down to Sheol which is easy.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:25
verses.text: To one man because of one that is dead, every man hastes to comfort him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:26
verses.text: But for me though many of my dead have come to life, there is none that comes in and comforts me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:27
verses.text: Satan came in, against Whom, had been proclaimed seven woes even against him; though mightily the Son of Mary had trodden on him, yet uplifted is his spirit; for he is the serpent that strives though bruised.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:28
verses.text: Better is it for me to fall and worship, before this Jesus Who has conquered me by His Cross.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:30
verses.text: When He enters at the gate of Sheol, in place of John who preached before His coming, then will I cry "Lo! He that quickens the dead is come; Thy servant am I from henceforth, Jesu! Because of The Body I reviled Thee, for it covered Thy Godhead.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:31
verses.text: Be not angry, O Son of the King, against Thy treasury; at Thy command I have opened and closed.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:32
verses.text: Though my wings be very swift it is at thy nod I haste to every quarter.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:34
verses.text: All that have been raised were not first born; for our Lord is the First-born of Sheol.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:35
verses.text: How can any that is dead go before Him, that power whereby he was raised? There are last that are first, and younger that have become first-born.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:36
verses.text: For though Manasseh was first-born, how could it be that Ephraim should take the birthright? And if the second born was set before him, how much rather shall the Lord and Creator prevent all in His Resurrection!  8.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:37
verses.text: Lo! John as a herald declares that he is later, though he was elder-born; for he said, "Behold a man cometh after me, and yet He was before me".

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:38
verses.text: For how could he be before Him, that Power in Whom he preached? For everything that comes to pass because of another thing, is after that other even though it seem to be before.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:39
verses.text: For the cause which called it into being, is elder than it and before it in all things.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:41
verses.text: The cause of Adam was elder than all creatures, which were made for him, for to him even to Adam He had respect continually, the Creator even while he was creating.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:42
verses.text: Thus though Adam as yet was not, he was elder than all creatures.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:43
verses.text: How much more then, my Lord, must this Thy manhood be elder, which in Thy Godhead is, from eternity with Him that begat Thee! To Thee be praise and through Thee to Thy Father from us all!  10.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:44
verses.text: To Thee be praise for Thou art the first, in Thy Godhead and in Thy manhood! For even though Elijah was first to go up, he was not able to prevent Him, for whose sake he was taken up.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:45
verses.text: For his type depended on Thy verity: and even though the types apparently are before Thy fulfilment, it is before them secretly.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:46
verses.text: Creatures were before Adam; he was before them because for his sake they were made.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:48
verses.text: O my Lord, work for me this resurrection, not of Thy compulsion but of Thy love.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:49
verses.text: For Thy compulsion gives life to sinners also: Iscariot would rather again choose for himself the death of Sheol, than the life of Gehenna.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:50
verses.text: Work for me then the resurrection that is of Thy mercy; and even though Thy justice permits not, let there be occasion for Thy grace.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 26:51
verses.text: This only let it remember for me, that in it I have sought refuge.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:1
verses.text: Hymn XXXIX.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:3
verses.text: There have come to me ransomers from among the saints, but none has plundered me like the Son of Mary.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:4
verses.text: For lo! Elijah brought a dead man to life; and even though he himself escaped from my hands, yet had I consolation after him, for the dead man whom he quickened, I carried off from him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:5
verses.text: By Elisha son of Shaphat, I was beaten as with rods, for he brought two dead men to life.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:6
verses.text: By one staff I in turn bore away both the prophet and the dead whom he had raised.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:7
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:8
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who cleft the tombs of Sheol by His voice!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:9
verses.text: I feared him even Gehazi when I saw, him lay the staff upon the youth.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:10
verses.text: The thief took the staff away and returned; Elisha came and bowed himself; laid himself low as the child and raised himself up, and walked hither and thither.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:11
verses.text: I marvelled at the new mysteries which I saw there, which restored but one youth to life.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:12
verses.text: It was well with me then when those were but mysteries, and not now when the dead have rebelled and conquered me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:14
verses.text: Moses when I saw the mighty splendour upon his face, I feared him: yet not according to what I feared befel it me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:15
verses.text: Nisan in Sheol he caused to spring for me; for a pasture, a pasture of corpses, of six hundred thousand fell.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:16
verses.text: —This lowly and despised whom I contemned, has healed the sick and the diseased: to others He has multiplied bread, but our bread even ours from our mouths He snatches.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:18
verses.text: A mighty feast there was in Sheol, when I swallowed up Korah and his company.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:19
verses.text: A great delight Satan made for me, when he made strife among the Levites.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:20
verses.text: A fount of milk and honey, made he flow for me in a dry place, when the congregation of transgressors went down to Sheol.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:21
verses.text: —Lo! the righteous have lived and come forth: Moses sent down the living thither, but Jesus has revived and brought up the dead.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:23
verses.text: It was well with me then, in the day of the zealous, those in whose swords I had delight.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:24
verses.text: Phinehas the zealous pierced and gave me, on the head of his spear for my delight, Zimri and Cozbi both together; on the head of his lance he presented them to me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:25
verses.text: To whom then were there ever two fatted oxen, offered on the head of a spear?—But instead of Cozbi, daughter of princes, the daughter of Jairus has Jesus rescued from my hands.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:27
verses.text: The censer of Aaron caused me to fear, for he stood between the dead and the living and conquered me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:28
verses.text: The Cross causes me to fear more exceedingly, which has rent open the graves of Sheol.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:29
verses.text: The Crucified Whom on it I slew, now by Him am I slain.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:30
verses.text: Not very great is his reproach, who is overcome by a warrior in arms.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:31
verses.text: Worse to me is my reproach than my torment, in that by a crucified man my strength has been overcome.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:33
verses.text: The lance of Phinehas again has caused me to fear, for by the slaughter he wrought with it he hindered the pestilence.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:34
verses.text: The lance guarded the tree of life, it made me glad and made me sad; it hindered Adam from life, and it hindered death from the people.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:35
verses.text: But the lance that pierced Jesus, by it I have suffered; He is pierced and I groan.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:36
verses.text: There came out from Him water and blood; Adam washed and lived and returned to Paradise.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:38
verses.text: The Sadducees were as a mouth for me, and disputed with Him after my mind, that there is no rising of the dead at all.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:39
verses.text: Jesus answered them in a saying, which I alone understood; He spake aloud the hateful word and saddened me, "I am the God of him even of Abraham, and God is not the God of the dead".

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:40
verses.text: It was well with me then these were but words, and He had not yet showed me the life of the dead indeed.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:42
verses.text: Jesus son of Nun, slew thirty kings, and filled the graves and pits for me; he laid waste Jericho and filled Sheol.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:43
verses.text: But this Jesus who is come, has wasted the graves of their dead, and has filled the cities of the upper world.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:44
verses.text: Wherefore thus when lo! they are like in their names, are they unlike in their doings? That gave me the body of Achor, but this snatched from me the body of Lazarus.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:46
verses.text: Moses trod down that Egyptian, with his meekness he mingled justice.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:47
verses.text: Whence has this new law sprung for me, "If one smite thee on thy cheek, turn to him thy other cheek, and see that thou hate him not?" Instead of the strong man of zeal who trod down and slew, a new man of mercy has risen for us.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:48
verses.text: Samuel hewed Agag in pieces, but Jesus healed the paralytic.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:50
verses.text: Tender mercy which had as it were waxed less, lo! in this time has waxed great.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:51
verses.text: And moreover it was then detested, lest through it one should transgress the commandment; for without mercy Saul and Ahab, were slain because they desired, to have mercy on the evil ones, and they were not slain who were deserving of punishment.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:52
verses.text: In my time Jesus has changed this, by giving life to all men and having compassion on His slayers.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:54
verses.text: I remember Samson that lion's whelp, who brake and gave me the pillars of Philistia; also that mighty man of valor Abner son of Ner, took for me that fleet wild roe, Asahel son of Zeruiah, and smote him and cast him on the ground.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:55
verses.text: Benaiah in the holy temple slew Jacob, justly as it is written.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:56
verses.text: —Because justice has restrained her sword, henceforth penitents shall rejoice in grace.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:58
verses.text: David measured the Edomites, by line and line and destroyed them.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:59
verses.text: How merciful then art Thou, O Son of David! David's justice was twofold, when he put to death two lines, and saved one full line alive.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:60
verses.text: —Lo! the Son of David teaches us, "Forgive thy brother even unto seventy times seven".

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:61
verses.text: There justice was measured; but here clemency is without measure.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:63
verses.text: Of zeal and strength David was possessed; the lion and the bear he slew together.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:64
verses.text: He left that mighty lion and hasted, to meet the strong giant.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:65
verses.text: With a stone he quenched his light, and his soul left him and he perished.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:66
verses.text: But Jesus cried to the young man that was dead "Young man!" Even the dead to Him are sleepers.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:67
verses.text: That young man He brought to life and rescued from me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:68
verses.text: The despised swine He drowned for me in the sea.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:70
verses.text: The Levites slew because of the calf, their fathers and their brethren.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:71
verses.text: Jephthah by his own hands was ready to slay his daughter.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:72
verses.text: The King of Moab on the wall, was sacrificing his first-born son: In presence of his sword I rejoice.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:73
verses.text: —By Jesus the sword was blunted; yea the fever was rebuked, the sister of Sheol: the mother-in-law of Simeon was healed, but the fame of her healing smote Sheol with pain.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:75
verses.text: This Jesus though he be the Son of the Just One, all that He preaches is grace.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:76
verses.text: But to me this His grace is torment.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:77
verses.text: Envy is the cause of pleasure to us, for Envy at the beginning mixed for me the first shedding of blood.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:78
verses.text: Why is it guilty in the sight of the Son of Mary Who is come commanding, "Thou shalt not be angry against thy brother?" He has taken away the sword from between brethren; while in the sword of Cain I had pleasure from the beginning.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:80
verses.text: An honeycomb in the midst of the skeleton, Samson found—was it then a mystery? This Jesus has multiplied for us mysteries.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:81
verses.text: Amid billows of mysteries have I fallen, which show me in parable the life of the dead, in all mysteries and in all types.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:82
verses.text: "Out of the eater came forth meat" was Samson's parable.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:83
verses.text: But to me it has befallen contrariwise; for the eater has come forth to me out of the meat, for out of Adam lo! has come the Son of Adam Who has destroyed me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:85
verses.text: Just men likewise have robbed me manifold, when by them was preached the rising of the dead: but they mingled with my sorrows great consolation.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:86
verses.text: By the prayer of Asa and Hezekiah, I was fed upon the dead, yea I feasted upon corpses.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:87
verses.text: Elijah slew the prophets of Baal and gave them to me, who on the bread of Jezebel had waxed fat.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:88
verses.text: The righteous has constrained me to devour, but Jesus has compelled me to disgorge all that I had eaten.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:90
verses.text: I was afraid because of the sprinkled blood, which Moses sprinkled on every door; for though the blood of the slain, it was that which saved the living.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:91
verses.text: Blood from of old I feared not, save that blood that was on the doors, and this moreover that was on the Tree.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:92
verses.text: The blood of the slain is a delight, and is as sweet perfume: but the blood of Jesus is to me a terror; for whenever I come and smell His blood, the savour of life that lurks therein terrifies me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:94
verses.text: Priests and pontiffs, anointed men and kings, who foreshow types of the rising of the dead, have never triumphed through their crosses.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:95
verses.text: Crowns and diadems were set on them; and when I engaged in struggles with them, I was smitten sometimes and sometimes also I smote.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:96
verses.text: But this carpenter's son with his crown of thorns, has humbled and cast down my pride, in His shame and His dying: Sheol has seen Him, yea, and fled from before Him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:98
verses.text: When the sea saw Moses and fled, it feared because of his rod, and likewise because of his glory.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:99
verses.text: His splendour and his rod and his power, the rock also saw which was cleft.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:100
verses.text: But Sheol when her graves were rent, what saw she in Him even in Jesus?—Instead of splendour He put on the paleness of the dead and made her tremble.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 27:101
verses.text: And if His paleness when slain slew her, how shall she be able to endure, when He comes to raise the dead, in His Glory!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:1
verses.text: Hymn XL.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:3
verses.text: The Evil One perceived his great humiliation, and boasted himself in the presence of his servants: he spoke great words to persuade them and said: "The knowledge which I possess, little of it is by nature; and much of it, yea all of it, is by learning.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:4
verses.text: I to myself have been master, and have exercised my understanding.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:5
verses.text: Without a teacher I have learnt all; I have armed myself with every weapon, and have won by it the crown which I desired among mankind".

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:6
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:7
verses.text: , Blessed is He that has come and undone the snares of sin!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:8
verses.text: Among the Pharisees I clothed myself in hatred, that I might contend with Him, even the Son of Mary.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:9
verses.text: Wrath like a bow rained shafts; boldness railed upon Him; fury rebelled against Him; ingratitude slandered Him; envy and jealousy in their wrath, strove with Him; and blasphemy took up stones.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:10
verses.text: The Healer came in and stood among the sick, and I stirred up the diseased in contention against Him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:12
verses.text: Because He fell not under reproach, it was in questions that I took refuge.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:13
verses.text: Many times did I stir up occasions, but I saw that my falsehood was rebuked, and my impudence was made known, and my vain babbling was despised.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:14
verses.text: To the windings of contention I betook myself.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:15
verses.text: Everywhere that I disputed with Him, all my labor was as chaff, and the word of truth scattered it on every side.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:17
verses.text: I saw that there is a warrior and a mighty lord, in cunning within man: [and the snake that is without makes it fear.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:18
verses.text: ] His lusts within him is coiled continually; his jealousy hisses like a serpent.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:19
verses.text: Deadly desires he begets, and of a fever he is in dread.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:20
verses.text: Command as a drug, is able to quell derision, which smites unto destruction.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:21
verses.text: It is love that avails to break the sting secret and bitter of the tongue.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:23
verses.text: Who is more foolish than men, who rather than for himself cares for his dwelling! The garments that are in his chest he examines daily, and a worm is lurking in his members.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:24
verses.text: The rents that are in his clothes he mends, but a rent is made in his soul.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:25
verses.text: His house is lighted up but his heart is dark.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:26
verses.text: He shuts up his senses but opens his windows.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:27
verses.text: He closes his door and guards his money; his mouth is open and the treasure of his thought is stolen.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:29
verses.text: The fool makes more of his beasts than of himself, for he cares for his possessions rather than for his soul.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:30
verses.text: Good seed he sows in his ground; in his heart he sows tares.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:31
verses.text: His understanding is thrown open and cast down; but at the fences of his vineyard he labours.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:32
verses.text: He chooses and plants vine-plants; while his mind is a vine of the vines of Sodom.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:33
verses.text: He keeps off the wild ass from his sowing; but the wild boar of the wood devours his thoughts.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:35
verses.text: I am a furnace to the sons of men, and in me are tried their counsels.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:36
verses.text: Therefore is it lawful to me to weave deceit.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:37
verses.text: I teach the Chaldean art: by reason of the true things that befall, the false things are believed.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:38
verses.text: In the midst of Egypt I closed men's eyes; I showed insects, men thought they were though they were not.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:39
verses.text: By closing men's eyes I teach the signs of the Zodiac, though they are not in the heavens.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:41
verses.text: By reason of my swiftness I fly and see, and I show beforehand to the soothsayer; they who err concerning me count me a prophet.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:42
verses.text: But sometimes I make bold; and I ask that for an hour, secret things be revealed to me, that true men may be proved by me even as Job, likewise deceivers as Saul.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 28:43
verses.text: For the one I revealed his sorcery; and for the other I purged his truth and he was praised.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:1
verses.text: Hymn XLI.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:3
verses.text: The Evil One said, "I fear Him, even Jesus, lest He destroy my arts.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:4
verses.text: For lo! I am thousands of years old, and never have I had repose.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:5
verses.text: I have seen nothing established, that I have turned from and left.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:6
verses.text: There has come One making the unchaste pure: there is sorrow since He has destroyed all that I had built.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:7
verses.text: Many have been my labours and my teachings, that I might cover all creation with all evils.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:8
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:9
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who came and laid bare the wiles of the Crafty One!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:10
verses.text: I matched my speed with the swift, and I outstripped them: I waged war; the tumult of multitudes was armour to me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:11
verses.text: In the tumult of the people I rejoiced, because it gave me ready room, for grievous is the onslaught of multitudes.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:12
verses.text: By the strength of multitudes I raised a great mountain, a tower I stretched unto heaven.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:13
verses.text: If they waged war with the Height, how much more shall they conquer Him whose warfare is on earth?  3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:14
verses.text: As time serves and as help offers, I wage war, but cautiously.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:15
verses.text: The people used to hear that God is one; they made for themselves a multitude of gods.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:16
verses.text: And when they saw the Son of God, they made haste to the One God, that as though confessing God they might deny Him, and as though in zeal might flee from Him; so that they in all times perverse shall be found to be without God.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:18
verses.text: Lo! I am ancient of many years, and no infant have I ever rejected.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:19
verses.text: The burden of children have I ofttimes borne, so that from the beginning I might make them acquire habits that are not goodly, that their faults might grow up with them.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:20
verses.text: But there are foolish fathers, who do not crush the seed that I have sown in their sons; and there are some who like good husbandmen, root up faults from the mind of their children.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:22
verses.text: As with a chain I have bound men with sloth, and they sat in idleness.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:23
verses.text: I have drawn away their senses from all good things; their eyes from reading, their mouths from singing praise, their understanding from doctrine.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:24
verses.text: For hurtful and vain fables how eager are they; for empty talk how ready! If the word of life fell among them, they either thrust it from them, or rose and went forth from its presence.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:26
verses.text: How many Satans are there among men! and me even me alone every man curses.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:27
verses.text: For lo! the anger of men—it is a devil that grinds him every day.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:28
verses.text: Demons are like wayfarers, who depart if they are compelled: but against anger though all righteous men adjure, it is not rooted out from its place.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:29
verses.text: Instead of pernicious envy, every one hates a weak and wretched demon.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:31
verses.text: The enchanter is put to shame with the wizard, who every day tames serpents.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:32
verses.text: The viper that is within him is out of his power; for the lust that is within him he tames not.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:33
verses.text: Secret sin like an asp, when it breathes on him he is scorched.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:34
verses.text: Even when he takes the viper through his cunning, delusion smites him secretly.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:35
verses.text: He lulls the snake by his incantations: he wakens against himself mighty wrath by his incantations.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:37
verses.text: I set my stings and I sat and waited: who is long-enduring as I with all? Beside the patient-spirited I sat, and step by step I bewitched him, so that he came unto despair.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:38
verses.text: Him who was ashamed of his transgressions, habits subdued him: little by little I mastered him, till he became under the yoke, till he came in to it and was used to it and did not even wish to go forth.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:40
verses.text: I perceived and saw that the long-enduring is he that can subdue all.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:41
verses.text: At the time when I conquered Adam, he was but one.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:42
verses.text: I left him till he had begotten children, and I sought for myself another task, for idleness is not to my taste.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:43
verses.text: I counted the sands of the sea, that thereby I might make my spirit patient, and might prove my memory whether it would suffice, for the sons of men when they were multiplied.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:44
verses.text: Before they were multiplied, I proved them in many things.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:46
verses.text: The servants of the Evil One disputed with him, and they refuted his words with their rejoinder.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:47
verses.text: "But lo! Elisha brought the dead to life, and conquered death in the upper chamber, and brought to life the widow's son.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:48
verses.text: Lo! now is he in bondage in Sheol".

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:49
verses.text: But because the reasoning of the Evil One was very powerful, with their own words he refuted their words.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:50
verses.text: "How has Elisha been overcome? Lo! in Sheol he brought the dead to life by his bones".

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:52
verses.text: "If Elisha, who was of small power, was great in might in the midst of Sheol, and if so be he brought one dead to life therein, how many dead then will be raised therein, by the death of Jesus the mighty! Hence even from this consider ye, how much greater therefore is Jesus, than we my comrades.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:53
verses.text: For lo! by His craftiness He deceived you, and ye sufficed not to determine His greatness when ye compared Him to the prophets.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:55
verses.text: "Your consolations are of small power," said the Evil One to them of his company.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:56
verses.text: "For He Who brought Lazarus to life though dead, how can Death suffice against Him? And if Death conquers Him, it is that He wills to be subdued unto him; and if so be He wills to be subdued, fear ye greatly, for He dies not in vain.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:57
verses.text: He has wrought in us great terror, lest when dying He may enter in to raise Adam to life".

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:59
verses.text: Death looked forth from within his den, and marvelled when he saw our Lord crucified, and he said "O raiser of the dead to life where art thou! Thou shalt be to me for meat, instead of the sweet Lazarus, whose savour lo! it is still in my mouth.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:60
verses.text: Jairus' daughter shall come and see this Thy cross.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:61
verses.text: The widow's son gazes on Thee.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:62
verses.text: A tree caught Adam for me: blessed be the Cross which has caught for me the Son of David!"  14.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:63
verses.text: Death opened his mouth and said, "Hast Thou not heard, O Son of Mary, how Moses was great and excellent above all? became a God and wrought the works of God? slew the first-born and saved the first-born? turned aside the pestilence from the living? To the mount I went up with Moses, and He Whose glory be blessed gave him to me from hand to hand.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:64
verses.text: For however great the son of Adam becomes, dust he is and to his dust returns, because he is of the ground".

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:66
verses.text: Satan came with his servants, that he might see our Lord cast into Sheol, and might rejoice with Death his Counsellor; and he saw Him sorrowful and mourning, because of the dead who at the voice of the Firstborn, lived and came forth thence even from Sheol.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:67
verses.text: The Evil One arose to console Death his kinsman.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:68
verses.text: "Thou hast not destroyed as much as thou wast able.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:69
verses.text: Even as Jesus is in thy midst, to thy hand shall come they that have lived and that live.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:71
verses.text: "Open for us to see Him, yea and mock Him: let us answer and say, 'Where is Thy power? For lo! three days have passed for Him, and let us say to Him, O Thou of three days, Who didst raise Lazarus, when he had lain four days, raise Thine own self.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 29:72
verses.text: '" Death opened the gates of Sheol, and there shone from it the splendour of the face of our Lord; and like the men of Sodom they were smitten; they groped and sought the gate of Sheol, which they had lost.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:1
verses.text: Hymn XLII.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:3
verses.text: The Evil One wailed "Where now, is there a place for me to flee to from the righteous? I stirred up Death to slay the Apostles, that I might be safe from their blows.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:4
verses.text: By their deaths now more exceedingly am I cruelly beaten.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:5
verses.text: The Apostle whom I slew in India is before me in Edessa: he is here wholly and also there.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:6
verses.text: I went there, there was he: here and there I have found him and been grieved".

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:7
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:8
verses.text: , Blessed is the might that dwells in the hallowed bones!  2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:9
verses.text: The bones that merchantmen carried, or was it then that they carried him? For lo! they made gain each of the other.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:10
verses.text: But for me what did they profit me? yea they profited each by each, while to me from both of them there was damage.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:11
verses.text: O that one would show me that bag of Iscariot, for by it I acquired strength! The bag of Thomas has slain me, for the secret strength that dwells in it tortures me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:13
verses.text: Moses the chosen carried the bones, in faith as for gain.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:14
verses.text: And if he a great prophet believed, that there is benefit in bones, the merchant did well to believe, and did well to call himself merchant.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:15
verses.text: That merchant made gain, and waxed great and reigned.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:16
verses.text: His storehouse has made me very poor: his storehouse has been opened in Edessa, and has enriched the great city with benefit.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:18
verses.text: At this storehouse of treasure I was amazed, for small was its treasure at first; and though no man took from it, poor was the spring of its wealth.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:19
verses.text: But when multitudes have come round it, and plundered it and carried off its riches, according as it is plundered, so much the more does its wealth increase.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:20
verses.text: For a pent-up spring, if one seeks it out, when deeply pierced it flows forth mightily and abounds.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:22
verses.text: It is evident that Elisha was a fountain in a thirsting people: and because they that thirsted sought him not out, his outflow was not great.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:23
verses.text: But when Naaman sought him out, he abounded and poured forth healing.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:24
verses.text: The fountain into the midst of a fountain, he took him and plunged him; for in the river he cleansed the leper.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:25
verses.text: Jesus the Sea of benefits, into Siloam sent the blind man whose eyes were opened.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:27
verses.text: Gehazi, with the staff that brought to life the dead, was unable to raise the child.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:28
verses.text: And how could the famous prophet have been brought up by the sorceress? We were they that mocked Saul, for instead of one demon whom he questioned, two demons came up and mocked him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:29
verses.text: From the bones of Elisha learn also of the bones of Samuel; for though Elisha's bones brought to life the dead, the sorcerers could not bring up the dead, the living and sacred bones.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:31
verses.text: And though I asked this petition, He who gives all gave it not to me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:32
verses.text: For though the demons were troubled, by the bones of some priest, or magician or wizard, of Chaldean or soothsayer, yet I was aware that this was but mockery.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:33
verses.text: In two ways I cause men to err: either I make the Apostles to lie, or I make my Apostles like the Apostles.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:35
verses.text: The party of the demons lo! it is spoiled; the party of the devils endures stripes: though there be none that lifts the rod openly, the demons cry out with pain; though there be none that fetters and binds, the spirits hang bound.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:36
verses.text: This silent judgment, which is calm and still, and works not even by questioning, the one power that is all sufficing, lo! it dwells in the bones of this second Elisha.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:38
verses.text: He gave judgment unto His Twelve, that they might judge the twelve Tribes.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:39
verses.text: And if so be that they are to judge the sons of the great Abraham, this is then no great matter, that they shall judge demons now.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:40
verses.text: And unless they make the crucifiers fulfil the judgment that is to be, by our judgment shall they be proved.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:41
verses.text: For worse than we did they cry out, in presence of the Apostles the judges of the tribes.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:43
verses.text: For a wolf was Saul the Apostle, and on the blood of the sheep I reared him; and he waxed strong and became a singular wolf.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:44
verses.text: But nigh to Damascus suddenly, the wolf was changed into a sheep.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:45
verses.text: He said that the Apostles, are to judge Angels; for by the Angels he signified the priest as it is written.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 30:46
verses.text: If so be then they are thus powerful, woe to the demons from the strokes of their bones!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:1
verses.text: Hymn LII.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:2
verses.text: Concerning Satan and Death.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:4
verses.text: I heard Death and Satan, as they disputed, which was the more powerful, among men.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:5
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:6
verses.text: , To Thee be glory, Son of the Shepherd of All, Who deliveredst His flock from the secret wolves that devoured it, the Evil One and Death!—2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:7
verses.text: Death showed his power, that he conquers all; Satan showed his guile, that he makes all to sin.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:9
verses.text: Death, To thee, O Evil One, none hearkens save he that wills: to me he that wills and he that wills not, even to me they come.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:11
verses.text: Satan, Thine, O Death, is but the force of tyranny: mine are snares and nets of subtlety.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:13
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:14
verses.text: , Hear, O Evil One, that who so is subtle breaks off thy yoke: but none is there that is able to escape my yoke.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:16
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:17
verses.text: , Thou, Death, on him that is sick provest thy might: but I over them that are whole, am exceeding powerful.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:19
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:20
verses.text: , The Evil One prevails not over all those that revile him: but for me he that has cursed me and he that curses me, come into my hands.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:22
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:23
verses.text: , Thou, Death, from God, hast gotten thy might: I alone by none am I helped, when I lead men to sin.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:25
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:26
verses.text: , Thou, O Evil-One, like a weakling: while like a king I exercise my dominion.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:28
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:29
verses.text: , Thou art a fool, O Death, not to know how great am I: who suffice to capture free will, the sovereign power.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:31
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:32
verses.text: , Thou, O Evil One, like a thief, lo! thou goest round: I like a lion break in pieces and fear not.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:34
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:35
verses.text: , To thee, O Death, none does service or worship: to me kings do service of sacrifice as to God.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:37
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:38
verses.text: , On Death there are many that call, as on a kind Power: on thee, O Evil One, none has called or calls.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:40
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:41
verses.text: , Markest thou not this, O Death, how many there are: who in sundry fashions call on me and make oblation?—15.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:42
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:43
verses.text: Hated is thy name, O Satan, nor canst thou clear it: thy name every one curses, hide thy reproach.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:45
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:46
verses.text: , Thine ear, O Death, has waxed dull, that thou hearest not: how against thee all men groan, conceal thyself.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:48
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:49
verses.text: , My face is shown to the world, for I am guileless: not like thee who without guile canst not abide.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:51
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:52
verses.text: , Thou hast not in aught surpassed me for it is true: that thou art hateful as I to the sons of men.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:54
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:55
verses.text: , Of me all men are afraid as of a lord: but as for thee they hate thee as the Evil One.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:57
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:58
verses.text: , For thee, O Death, they hate thy name, and also thy work: my name they hate but my delights they greatly love.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:60
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:61
verses.text: , To bitterness of teeth is turned, this thy sweetness: penitence of soul cleaves ever unto thy lusts.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:63
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:64
verses.text: , Sheol is hated because in her is no repentance: a pit that swallows and closes on all movements.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:66
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:67
verses.text: , Sheol is a gulf wherein whoso falls shall rise again: sin is hated because it cuts off the hope of man.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:69
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:70
verses.text: , Though I mislike penitents, I give place for repentance: thou cuttest off hope from the sinner who dies in his sin.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:72
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:73
verses.text: , It was of thee that at first his hope was cut off: for he whom thou hast not caused to sin dies happily.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:75
verses.text: Blessed is He who raised against each other those cursed servants: that we might see them as they have seen us and mocked at us.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 31:77
verses.text: This that we have seen of them is a pledge, my brethren: of what we shall see of them hereafter when we rise again.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:1
verses.text: Hymn LIII.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:3
verses.text: Come, let us hear how they contend for victory: the guilty ones who never have conquered, nor will conquer.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:5
verses.text: Death said unto the Evil One, In the end the victory is mine: for Death is master of the close, as a conqueror.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:7
verses.text: Satan, This were to be Death indeed, wert thou able: to bring to death a living man, by means of lusts.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:9
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:10
verses.text: , Lo! I who behold the dead, both good and bad: the righteous who despise thee, O Evil One, me they despise not.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:12
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:13
verses.text: , This dying of the body, is sleep for a time: think not, O Death, that thou art Death, who art as a shadow.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:15
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:16
verses.text: , Thee, O Evil One, the just have conquered, yea will conquer: but these that have conquered thee, lo! I conquer.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:18
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:19
verses.text: , Even this that thou bringest to death the just, is not of thyself: because of Adam whom I conquered, they drink this cup.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:21
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:22
verses.text: , Lo! Sheol is full of the men of Sodom, and the Assyrians: and the giants who were in the flood, who is like me?—9.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:23
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:24
verses.text: , These, O Death, all of them, by me were slain: I am he that caused them to sin so that they perished.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:26
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:27
verses.text: , Joseph who conquered thee I conquered, O Satan: in the chamber he conquered thee but I conquered, and cast him into the tomb.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:29
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:30
verses.text: , Moses who conquered thee, O Death, by sprinkling of blood: he conquered thee in Egypt, but at the rock, who conquered him?—12.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:31
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:32
verses.text: , Elijah who feared thee not, O Satan: fled before Jezebel's face, because he feared me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:34
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:35
verses.text: , Aaron who withstood thee, O Death, with smoke of incense: to him I gave earrings of gold: and he fashioned a calf.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:37
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:38
verses.text: , Thou wentest down to contend with Job, and he conquered thee and came up: but I, after he had conquered thee, then conquered him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:40
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:41
verses.text: , David who by his sackcloth stayed that pestilence: him on the house-top I conquered, who had conquered Goliath.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:43
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:44
verses.text: , Jehu who destroyed the house of Baal, the temple of the Evil One: was unable to destroy Sheol, the stronghold of my realm.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:46
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:47
verses.text: , Solomon who snatched from thy mouth, a child by his judgment: him in his old age I made a builder of idol-altars.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:49
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:50
verses.text: , Samuel who in respect of gold scorned thee, O Satan: him I conquered, the conqueror, who conquered bribes.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:52
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:53
verses.text: , Samson who in respect of the lion's whelp, scorned thee, O Death: through Delilah, frail vessel, I yoked him to the mill.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:55
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:56
verses.text: , Josiah from his childhood despised thee, Evil One: but me not even in his old age, could he withstand.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:58
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:59
verses.text: , Hezekiah withstood thee, Death, when he overcame the bound of life: I misled him and he neglected the miracle, and showed his treasures.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:61
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:62
verses.text: , John who conquered thee, Evil One, and absolved and baptized: I extinguished that torch, which had disclosed thee.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:64
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:65
verses.text: , Simon overcame thee, when he brought to life that blessed woman: in a woman he overcame thee and by a woman I overcame him and made him deny.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:67
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:68
verses.text: , Apostles and prophets with one voice, curse thee, O Death: "Where is the victory of Death, and the sting of Sheol?"—25.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:69
verses.text: Thy Lord in Sheol thou hast shut up, O cursed servant: God hates thee and also man, hold then thy peace.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:71
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:72
verses.text: , It was the will of Him who gives life to all, that shut him in Sheol: it was thou that called Him to this, when thou madest Adam sin.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 32:74
verses.text: O comrade of Nabal who in the wilderness reproached his lord: abhorred be thy mouth which said to Him, "Fall down and worship me!".

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:1
verses.text: Hymn LIV.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:3
verses.text: Hear, O Freedom, the dispute of two servants: how they are convicted by each other, that they are powerless.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:5
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:6
verses.text: , To Thee be glory by Whose humiliation Adam was exalted: and by Whose death he was raised, and regained Eden!—3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:7
verses.text: If then the Evil One overcome thee, great is the shame: Death his comrade has convicted him, as being weak.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:9
verses.text: And if again Death subdue thee, lo! what reproach: for the Evil One his comrade derides him, as but a shadow.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:11
verses.text: Their dispute is for thee a mirror, wherein thou mayest see: that they both are but as chaff, before thy breath.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:13
verses.text: Yea and Prophets and Apostles, in their promises: assure thee that they like flowers, shall fade at the rising.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:15
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:16
verses.text: , Thou, Death, art he whom they hate, the quick and dead: for every combination thou dissolvest, and destroyest.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:18
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:19
verses.text: , It is not open death that kills, O Satan: thy death which is secret kills the sons of men.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:21
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:22
verses.text: , My name is not hateful as thine, for the angel: showed himself in Satan's likeness to Balaam on the way.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:24
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:25
verses.text: , How fit is this thy name, O Satan: who hast erred and made unwary Adam err, from the way!—11.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:26
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:27
verses.text: , Wander not like one ignorant, and lose thy cause: dispute, O Death, if thou are competent, for replying.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:29
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:30
verses.text: , I know that thou art wily, O Satan: so that thou out of sand canst twist a snare.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:32
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:33
verses.text: , Thy disputing, Death, is ended: for he who is worsted: when his words fail and are ended, begins to rail.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:35
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:36
verses.text: , Among all I am conqueror, and by thee am I worsted? Let Adam persuade thee whom I have overcome, O Satan!—15.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:37
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:38
verses.text: , I am he who bound Adam, and cast him before thee: the mighty man whom my wiles had bound, thou didst come and subdue.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:40
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:41
verses.text: , I am he who have been crowned anew, with a diadem in the world: for Adam, chief of the mighty, I hold captive in Sheol.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:43
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:44
verses.text: , I killed him by secret death, even Adam when he sinned: thou, Death, hast slain one that was dead, killed by me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:46
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:47
verses.text: , In thy desire to conquer, Evil One, thou hast made thyself hated: for thou art Death as well as Satan, and this seems a little thing to thee.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:49
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:50
verses.text: , Thou hast then been silenced, Death, as a weakling: for neither in words nor in deeds, hast thou strength to stand.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:52
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:53
verses.text: , It is for thy evil thou conquerest, O Evil One, if thou discernest: thy crown is wholly of shame, if thou perceivest.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:55
verses.text: I shall be defeated and thou shalt be cursed, O Satan: it is well for me to be ignorant, and not mischievous.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:57
verses.text: Blessed be the Just One who divided them, though they were quite of one mind: Blessed be the Good One who made us of one mind, when we were divided.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 33:59
verses.text: I will overcome the Evil One through Thy forgiveness, O All-Merciful: and I shall overcome death through Thy Resurrection, O All-Life-giver!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:1
verses.text: Hymn LV.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:3
verses.text: Lo! the Evil One reproached Death, and was in turn reproached: from each and to each and against each, were their taunts.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:5
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:6
verses.text: , To Thee be glory, Son of the Lord of All, Who diedst for all: for He was raised to give life to all, in the day of His Coming!—3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:7
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:8
verses.text: , Jonah who conquered thee, and returned back from Sheol, became my advocate in asking, why sinners were spared?—4.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:9
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:10
verses.text: , Slander not, O Evil One, the son of Amittai: he showed a face of anger, that they might praise thee more.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:12
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:13
verses.text: , Quite powerless is all thy persuasion, O tyrant Death: for there pleases me nothing, of all thou hast said.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:15
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:16
verses.text: , For when was the word of truth pleasing to thee? A gulf is between thee and truthfulness, O lying one.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:18
verses.text: I am righteous all my days, with nought to repent: I am he that rescues from thee the sons of men.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:20
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:21
verses.text: , Proclaim thy repentance, Death, thou art well come: lo! Saul also among the prophets, great cause of scorn.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:23
verses.text: If thou, Death, be justified, then for myself: I cut not off hope, likewise, of repentance.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:25
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:26
verses.text: , No idol with my Lord have I made, O hater of thy Lord! lo! thou by dead idols, slayest the living.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:28
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:29
verses.text: , That thou, Death, art half of me, I know, and I half of thee: if half of me repents, it repents, but I marvel.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:31
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:32
verses.text: , Thy partner am I in share, but not in sin: mine are the slain and thine the slayers, whom thou madest sin.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:34
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:35
verses.text: , My craftiness weeps for itself, when I dispute with thee: my wiles mourn over me, when I meet thee.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:37
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:38
verses.text: , Workers of witchcraft and soothsayers, with all their offences: the fire that thou kindledst in the world, in Sheol I have quenched.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:40
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:41
verses.text: , Thou penitent who strainest out gnats, and swallowest the just: the chaste shall rend thee, who cry, from within thy belly.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:43
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:44
verses.text: , It is the treasure-house where I keep all the righteous: their resurrection threatens ill to thee, who didst persecute them.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:46
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:47
verses.text: , The greedy one who carries all creatures, in his bowels: lo! he casts up to me that I am robbed, of my possessions.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:49
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:50
verses.text: , Before the stroke lament not, for it has not yet reached thee: the day will come when thou shalt cry out, and I shall hear and rejoice.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:52
verses.text: The fire will come that shall strip off thee thy very skin: as by the potsherd thou didst strip the skin of Job.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:54
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:55
verses.text: , The savour of sloth begins, as if to hover on me; it is then a dream that I ceased, for a short space.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:57
verses.text: It was not that words failed me, and therefore I was silent: it is for the time I grieve, that has passed idly.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:59
verses.text: The hurt done by thy speech is very great: would I had not heard it! For my whole mind is intent upon my work.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:61
verses.text: This humankind that is lost, was undone by wandering thought: slothfulness, with negligence, brought it under yoke.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:63
verses.text: The madness of desire bid for wealth, and bought it: contention with boastfulness, were the sureties.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:65
verses.text: With persistence for strength, I wage my war: and if I neglect but a little, my sway is naught.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:67
verses.text: By continual dropping, I clean the rocks: for continual dropping can dissolve even a mountain.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:69
verses.text: Habit even over nature, becomes master: it trains and leads even lions, as beasts of burden.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:71
verses.text: Habit, repose, and increase, with persistence; by these is freedom conquered, though stubborn above all.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:73
verses.text: If its will be firmly set, it breaks the fetters; but if lax, a fragile net, can capture it.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:75
verses.text: If so be that Freedom shouts, we are scattered: but if she be silent we gather together, to mock at her.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:77
verses.text: Let us cease from much speaking, lest it lead to much sloth: with one mind let us assail the wall, and lo! it is broken down.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:79
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:80
verses.text: , Go thou and see to diseases, and I to snares: for to me sins and to thee pestilences, are great solace.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 34:82
verses.text: And even though I have paused, I have not paused from my cares: for my will at no time rests, but is ready.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:1
verses.text: Hymn LVI.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:3
verses.text: With Freedom is thy struggle, O Evil One: it can cast on thee a muzzle, if it so please.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:5
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:6
verses.text: , To Thee be glory in whose victory we have gained strength: and in whose resurrection we defy even Death itself!—3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:7
verses.text: Lo! again these two exposed each other, how weak both are: Death reminded the Evil One of thy mightiness (O Freedom).

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:9
verses.text: Thy fire is in thy nest, O Death, and thou perceivest not: the fate of the departed, to thee is overthrow.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:11
verses.text: Lo! Death and the Evil One proclaim thy mightiness (O Freedom): yea, the Evil One calls to mind thy faith.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:13
verses.text: If then these that were against thee are on thy side: this is a great thing that thy persecutors have become thy heralds,—7.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:14
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:15
verses.text: , I confess, O Evil One, that as usury: I lay up the King's treasures, till His Coming.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:17
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:18
verses.text: , I, O Death, rather deny that this belongs to God: this treasure of subtlety, which I have stored.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:20
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:21
verses.text: , Thy coinage is fraudulent, then, O Satan: that into the treasuries of God, is not received.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:23
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:24
verses.text: , A new coinage do I coin, in kingly wise: lo! my merchantmen bring loss, into the world.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:26
verses.text: God created everything out of nothing: and I created great sin out of nothing—12.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:27
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:28
verses.text: , Closed and bound be thy mouth, Evil One, who art thus bold: to set thyself, lo! in comparison with the Creator.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:30
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:31
verses.text: , To me, O Death, it is lawful to dare and speak: thy tongue, even thine, is a slave, and under fear.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:33
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:34
verses.text: , A gulf is henceforth between us, O Satan: for madly against thy Lord, lo! thou assailest.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:36
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:37
verses.text: , Wherefore doubtest thou, O Death, of our concord? Be to us comrade and member: and lo! we reign.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:39
verses.text: Come, draw we our pair of swords, against mankind: I secretly, thou openly, and lo! we end them.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:41
verses.text: Sin and Sheol they too gave counsel to those two: saying "If ye be divided, ye are undone".

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:43
verses.text: See the waters how if dispersed, they run low: but if gathered they gain strength, and thus ye likewise.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:45
verses.text: If divided ye perish, as the feeble: but yoked together ye reign, as the mighty.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:47
verses.text: Love melts down many, as in a furnace: and makes one powerful mass, that overcomes all.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:49
verses.text: In it are wisdom and cunning, and force and power: it is greater far than an image of sixty cubits.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:51
verses.text: Be reconciled, let us assemble and go, against that party: which if it be at one can never be defeated.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:53
verses.text: These things the troublers discoursed, and gathered and came: Thy day, Lord, will gather them, into Gehenna.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 35:55
verses.text: Through Thy mercy, Lord, will I worship Thee, when I have risen: at Thy trumpet I will praise Thy Son, when I am purged.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:1
verses.text: Hymn LVII.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:3
verses.text: Listen, my brethren, to Death, mocking the Evil One: that caused the head of our race to sin, and its mother.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:5
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:6
verses.text: , To Thee be glory that by Thy humiliation, Satan is subdued: and that Thy abasement has exalted Adam, who was abased.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:8
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:9
verses.text: , Thy great nakedness shall be seen, by the sons of Adam; as thou mockedst his nakedness, when thou madest him sin.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:11
verses.text: Eve will cease from that serpent, and rail at thee: for thou, O Dragon, wast he that beguiled her simpleness.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:13
verses.text: Abel will see him, even, Cain, who has come to thee: the disciple of his wrath will blame his cursed master.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:15
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:16
verses.text: , Noah who conquered the flood, as it were death: by the mouth of Ham I laughed at, when wine overcame him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:18
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:19
verses.text: , Noah was not harmed, but thy garment, wherewith thou clothedst him: even cursings, he put on, and became a slave.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:21
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:22
verses.text: , Lot who overcame anger which is, thy likeness, Death: to his daughters I gave such counsels, as were pleasing to me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:24
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:25
verses.text: , And Lot's wife who was thy vessel hearkened, to thy counsel: may half of thee be dried up, as thy whole vessel was dried up!—10.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:26
verses.text: Gehenna be overturned, upon thy head: as thy malice overturned Sodom, its dwellers!—11.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:27
verses.text: Floods of fire be stirred against thee, in the resurrection: who against Moses and Elijah, didst stir the people!—12.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:28
verses.text: Let the just mock thee at the last, and Joseph rejoice! whose brethren mocked him, set on by thee!—13.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:29
verses.text: Let vapour of smoke come in, and choke thy senses: as the waters of the sea choked, the senses of the wicked! —14.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:30
verses.text: Let chaste women also mock thee, by whose counsel: the daughters of Midian mocked, the foolish people!—15.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:31
verses.text: Flame be kindled on thy head, for Samson's sake: for by a woman thou shavedst his locks, that lion of strength!—16.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:32
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:33
verses.text: , Saul whom I conquered by envy, by witchcraft conquered thee: for he asked for and brought up Samuel, out of his grave.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:35
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:36
verses.text: , Slander not the living dead, for he came not up: thou wast he that came up in the phantom for thou wast worthy.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:38
verses.text: Let the commandment hang thee over the flame, thou Evil One! for by thee they hanged Absalom, upon a tree.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:40
verses.text: In the fire mayst thou see thyself humbled, among vile women! for Solomon by thee was degraded, among profane women.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:42
verses.text: Justice be measured to thee, as thou didst inflame her! even Jezebel who devoured the prophets, thou kindledst her.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:44
verses.text: In fire mayst thou justly burn, who madest them drunken! the two whom Elijah burnt up, when they went up and assailed him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:46
verses.text: On thee also be coals heaped! may he see and rejoice: that Naboth in whom thou heapedst, a pile of stones!—23.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:47
verses.text: Be thou clad in scorn in the day of judgment, before all beholders! who clothedst Gehasi in a leprosy, by means of thy theft.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:49
verses.text: With lightning for a dart be thou pierced, O Satan! who in the heart of Josiah, didst fix thy darts.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:51
verses.text: Sink thou in the dregs of Gehenna, O Satan! who didst sink Jeremiah in the mire of the pit.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:53
verses.text: Daniel escaped from the pit, whither thou didst cast him: may he have comfort in seeing thee, in the furnace for ever!—27.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:54
verses.text: Be thy wickedness returned on thy head, Hater of man: as his wickedness was returned on the head, of Haman thy fellow! —28.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:55
verses.text: May the King's Bride mock thee, as did Esther: when thou beseechest her in the judgment-day, to plead for thee!—29.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:56
verses.text: Fire released the righteous ones, whom thou hadst bound: a mighty bond be to thee, the flame of fire!—30.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:57
verses.text: Be thou torn in sunder, and may the seven brothers, see thy defeat: the sons of Shemuni who by thy wolves, were torn in sunder!—31.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:58
verses.text: May fire triumph over thy pate, as thou didst mock: the two heads of Nazarites, sons of the barren!—32.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:59
verses.text: May fire make mock of thy head, for mother and daughter: triumphed over John's head, when thou didst madden them!—33.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 36:60
verses.text: Flame triumphed over thy head, O Evil One: for on the charges thou didst triumph, over John's head!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:1
verses.text: Hymn LVIII.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:3
verses.text: Lo! Death was prompt beforehand, to mock Satan: him who was doomed to become a mockery at the last.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:5
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:6
verses.text: , Glory to Thee Who by Thy crucifixion, didst conquer the Evil One: and by Thy resurrection gain victory, likewise over Death!—3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:7
verses.text: And for our Lord's sake Death spake curses on him: who was the cause of His shame, and crucifixion.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:9
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:10
verses.text: , The fiery pit be thy grave, O Satan: who blasphemedst the Voice from the grave, that rent the graves—5.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:11
verses.text: My Lord I know, and the Son of my Lord, O thou Satan! thou hast denied thy Lord, and crucified the Son of thy Lord.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:13
verses.text: This is the name that fits thee, "Slayer of thy Lord": when He appears Whom thou slewest, He shall slay thee.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:15
verses.text: At thee shall every one shake the head, for by thee the chiefs: shook their heads at Him, the Lord of life.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:17
verses.text: A bruised reed under the feet, of the just shalt thou be: for through thee they put a reed in His hand, Who upholds all.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:19
verses.text: With a crown of thorns was He crowned, to signify: that He took the diadem of the kingdom, of the house of David.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:21
verses.text: With a crown of thorns was He crowned, the King of kings: but He took the diadem of the king, of those that shamed him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:23
verses.text: In the robes of mockery that they gave him, in those He mocked them: for He took the raiment of glory, of priests and kings.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:25
verses.text: To vinegar is thy memory akin, O thou Satan: who didst offer vinegar for the thirst, of the Fount of Life.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:27
verses.text: The hand shall every man lift against thee who strengthenedst the hand that smote Him by Whose hand, all creatures stand.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:29
verses.text: He was smitten by the hand and He cut off the hand, of Caiaphas: the hand of the priesthood is cut off, in the cutting off of the unction.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:31
verses.text: On the pillar again they stretched Him, as for scourging: Him Whose pillar went before, to guide their tribes.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:33
verses.text: The pillar on the pillar, He was scourged: He removed Himself from out of Zion, and its fall came.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:35
verses.text: When they put two beams together, to form the Cross: He broke them, even the two staves, the guardians of them.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:37
verses.text: Ezekiel put together the sticks, the two in one: in the two beams of the Cross, their staves have ceased.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:39
verses.text: The two sticks, as it were wings, bore the people: lo! his two staves were broken, even as his wings.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:41
verses.text: The bosom and wings of the Cross, He opened in mercy: its pinions bowed and bore the nations, to go to Eden.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:43
verses.text: It is akin to the Tree of Life, and unto the son of its stock: it leads its beloved that on its boughs, they may feed on its fruits.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:45
verses.text: Go howl and weep, Evil One, for me and for you: for not one of us shall enter the "Garden of Life".

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:47
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:48
verses.text: , Now that thou hast confessed O Death, come let me tell thee: that all this discourse of thine, to me is idle talk.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:50
verses.text: I will go and watch the snares, which I have set: thou too, Death, fly and look after, all that are sick.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 37:52
verses.text: Our Lord has brought both to nought, on either hand: the Evil One shall be brought to nought here, and Death hereafter there.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:1
verses.text: Hymn LIX.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:3
verses.text: Lo! Death for us on Satan, inflicts vengeance: come let us hear his shame and rejoice, for he rejoiced in our shame.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:5
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:6
verses.text: , To Thee be glory from Thy flock, from Thee: are subdued both Death and Satan, under Thy Feet!—3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:7
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:8
verses.text: , Evil ones shall be hung upright, but thou, head downward: for, reversely, thou crucifiedst, Simon on the tree.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:10
verses.text: S.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:11
verses.text: , Touching all else I am silent, Death, for my time wanes: Simon himself conjured me, "Crucify me thus".

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:13
verses.text: Were it the just that cursed me, I had not grieved: the curse of Death unto me, is worse than hell.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:15
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:16
verses.text: , The shame of our Lord I have not spoken of, it is too great for my mouth: that I should weigh and compare His Passion, with Thy torment.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:18
verses.text: Twelve judgment thrones shall He set, for His Twelve: for by the twelve tribes thou, even thou, shall be condemned.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:20
verses.text: A halter unbought shalt thou hang thee, O thou Satan: as that Thy disciple hung him, a halter for a price.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:22
verses.text: Haply yon hell in mercy, shall be emptied: and thou shalt dwell there alone, with Thy ministers.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:24
verses.text: Manifold are Thy curses, and how shall I count them? Lo! the sum of all thy curses, is on thy members.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:26
verses.text: The evil in the fire shall stab thee, who madest them evil: they shall upbraid thee "wherefore, broughtest thou us hither?"—12.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:27
verses.text: Sinners shall rail against thee, and haply their threats: shall be worse to thee than the torment, of yonder hell.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:29
verses.text: These shall be unto thee there, all of them Satans: as thou hast been to them here, the one Satan.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:31
verses.text: The Watchers shall seize and hurl thee down, calling to mind: how through thee men hurled their Lord, from the height to the depth.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:33
verses.text: All men will run to stone thee, not forgetting that through thee the maddened people ran, to stone their Maker.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:35
verses.text: On thee, Evil One, from all mouths shall be, the spitting of wrath: for through thee they spat on Him Whose spittle, gave sight to the blind.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:37
verses.text: On thee, Evil One, from all tongues, shall be all curses: for through thee men blasphemed Him, Who opened dumb mouths.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:39
verses.text: Blessed is He Who avenged our wrong, though in silence: and stirred up Death against the Evil One, to fall upon him!—19.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 38:40
verses.text: Sound we Hosannas, my brethren, as did Gideon: who when he sounded, the oppressors, fell on one another!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:1
verses.text: Hymn LX.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:3
verses.text: O what amazement befel the Evil One, of a sudden, my brethren: when the sinful woman was corrected, and gained Wisdom!—2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:4
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:5
verses.text: , Glory to the One Who alone, conquered the Evil One; and to Him yea Him be also confession, Who vanquished Death!—3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:6
verses.text: The Evil One marvelled "Where is her laughter? where her perfumes? where her dancing and outward ornament, and inward wickedness?"—4.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:7
