verses.text: Instead of that light laughter, she is given up to tears: She has cut off her hair to wipe the dust, off the feet of Jesus.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:9
verses.text: Naught lasts in her of any doctrine, nor abides in her: from our instruction she has escaped and cast away, all that I taught her.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:11
verses.text: She has denied us and our acquaintance, and even as though: she had never seen me she has blotted my image, out of her mind.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:13
verses.text: The living leaven of Jesus flew to her, Jesus was silent: but she made bold to press and enter, though none called her.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:15
verses.text: She forgot our love of many years, and in the twinkling of an eye: from between me and her she removed it, and set Death there.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:17
verses.text: For instead of laughter weeping delights her, and instead of paint: a shower of tears, and instead of ornament, a sad countenance.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:19
verses.text: Zaccheus I made chief of extortioners, and her I made: chief of wantons; my two wings, Jesus has broken.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:21
verses.text: If so be Zaccheus becomes his disciple, and if so be she: becomes his hearer, henceforth they fetter, my craftiness.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:23
verses.text: Carved images henceforth are a mockery and the carvers: a derision, and the worshippers a laughing-stock.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:25
verses.text: I shut men's eyes that they might not perceive, that they are carved images: Jesus opens their eyes to see that they are the works of men's hands.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:27
verses.text: If Jesus has chosen for Himself preachers, then our preaching: whereof the whole world is full, is put to silence.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:29
verses.text: For lo! the Chaldeans with the soothsayers, and lo! the wizards: with the diviners they are smitten and the priests, with all evil ones!—16.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:30
verses.text: Ye priests are ended and have given up the Ghost from henceforth, depart ye diviners! become husbandmen, the Chaldeans likewise, shall close their books.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:32
verses.text: If the Hebrews have become His disciples, who by all miracles: were not subdued, who of the nations, shall not obey him?—18.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:33
verses.text: If he begins to set straight the reverse, He brings to naught our speech: henceforth He will not hesitate against us, He who rebukes all men.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:35
verses.text: In that I was worshipped in all temples, our disgrace is greater: than our honour was, for all men spit, upon our altars.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:37
verses.text: Flesh of sacrifice becomes abhorred, into fragments: idols are broken, and carven images burn, under their pots.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:39
verses.text: All our work becomes a laughing-stock, and a ruin: all that we have built, and a mockery, all that we have taught.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:41
verses.text: The secret mysteries that I taught them, laboriously: are about to be spread abroad, on the housetops.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:43
verses.text: Of the Egyptians I was more proud, than of any nation: for they used to worship even, the onions and garlic.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:45
verses.text: Lo! I fear lest even here, where delusion was so great: truth shall prevail that there exceedingly, Jesus may reign.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:47
verses.text: And if when He was an infant, and fled and went down, Egypt marvelled: yea lulled him—this strangler of babes, loved their Babe.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:49
verses.text: Was it a pledge He went down to give her, as a betrother: giving assurance that when of full age, He will also take her to wife?—27.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:50
verses.text: Pharaoh cannot set his foot firm, for this is no stammerer: that he should deceive Him, and no bondman, that he should lie unto Him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:52
verses.text: Moses smote and the Egyptians rebelled, and he chastised the people: and the Hebrews rebelled—Jesus is smitten, and gives life to all.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:54
verses.text: This is hard to understand that not by force; lays He His yoke: on the rebellious: He was rebuked, and He instructs others.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:56
verses.text: The spittle of His mouth, wiped off and took away, the shame of Adam: by the smiting of His cheeks, He rooted out our wrathfulness, from His disciples.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:58
verses.text: By the nails which he received, He made me to suffer.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 39:59
verses.text: I rejoiced when I crucified Him: and I knew not that He was crucifying me, in His crucifixion.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:1
verses.text: Hymn LXI.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:3
verses.text: In wisdom let us hearken to Death, O my beloved: how he accuses us for our weeping, and for our mourning.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:5
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:6
verses.text: , To thee be praise Who cameth down, to follow Adam: and foundest Adam and also in the children of Adam.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:8
verses.text: And rightly perhaps he says, "Ye slay: without mercy and lo! ye weep, as though merciful".

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:10
verses.text: Ye have made me as a cruel one, O ye murderers: for ye slay one another, without my help!—5.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:11
verses.text: While Death was but desiring to come, the sword came before him: let us see then against whom cries out, the blood of the slain.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:13
verses.text: Against you cry out the strangled, who were suffocated: for it shames me of the rope, of their strangulations.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:15
verses.text: They take away from me even my rest, for without me: how could the strangled and the slain, enter Sheol?—8.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:16
verses.text: Lo! your infants are cast out, as those in Egypt: your sons have ye sacrificed to demons, O demoniacs!—9.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:17
verses.text: While Death was but desiring to taste, of your corpses: Cain refreshed me beforehand, with blood of man.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:19
verses.text: While I was but desiring to wait patiently, till Adam should die: before I had power ye gave me power, over your bodies.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:21
verses.text: Cain with his sword overthrew, the gate of Sheol: for it was closed and before the time, he first opened it.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:23
verses.text: He by treading made the way of Sheol, without my help: for in the way ye have trodden out for me, lo! I walk therein.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:25
verses.text: Nine hundred years I sat and waited, for Adam to die: but Cain not even a day, endured his brother.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:27
verses.text: Robbers upon the highways, are worse than I: I am slumbering while they, are watching to slay.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:29
verses.text: Lo! your slaughtered in the graves, and your murdered in your ways; and your strangled upon your stakes!—16.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:30
verses.text: "If I rebelled against my lord, yea and slew him: who was he that slew these here," said Jehu.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:32
verses.text: And if I Death have taken, your departed: the strangled, the slain, and the slaughtered, who was it slew them?—18.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:33
verses.text: Ye are Satan to each other, and the Evil One is abhorred: ye are pestilence to each other, and Death is blamed!—19.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:34
verses.text: Your own will to you is Satan, yea and a murderer: but of Death and of Satan, all men complain.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:36
verses.text: Poison of Death ye give also to drink, each to other: lo! how many Deaths have ye, beside me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:38
verses.text: Wiles, stratagems, yea and snares, sword and poison: how many Deaths from you and in you, lo! are there born.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:40
verses.text: The judge in the judgment-hall, is a second Death: he slays for secret reward, but I for naught.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:42
verses.text: I have seen bribery and marvelled at it, that ran and outran me: how many slain does bribery, slay, and none perceives!—24.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:43
verses.text: I am ashamed that so unskilfully, I conduct myself: if I take even one corpse, all men perceive it.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:45
verses.text: In the houses weeping and in the streets, also wailing: and even unto the gates of Sheol, they groan over me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:47
verses.text: Groan over yourselves that ye are thus hateful, and ye hate me: Sheol henceforth shall groan over you, O murderers!—27.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:48
verses.text: With torture, scourging and fire, yea with stoning: ye put to death the sons of men, and ye are proud!—28.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:49
verses.text: I am more modest than you and merciful, also reverent: for with reverence I bear away, your departed.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 40:51
verses.text: On the bed I deal gently, with him that is sick: and quietly I lay him to sleep, for but a while.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:1
verses.text: Hymn LXII.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:3
verses.text: Lo! Death, the King of silence, complains, my brethren: that we have filled his abode with the wailing, of Hope cut off.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:5
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:6
verses.text: , To Him be great praise Who comest down, to us here below: and suffered and rose again and in His Body, raises our bodies!—3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:7
verses.text: While we weep like madmen, at the gates of Sheol: hearken what Death says, reproaching us.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:9
verses.text: It shames me, says Death, that ye, have overcome me: the half of Sheol suffices not, to contain your slain.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:11
verses.text: For alien corpses together, lie heaped in Sheol: there are two divisions there, the dead, the slain.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:13
verses.text: Whereas I should complain that ye have wronged me, lo! ye are weeping: ye have burst the gate of Sheol, and done me hurt.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:15
verses.text: For ye are like unto an infant, which while yet weeping: laughs again as ye also, over your dead.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:17
verses.text: For there is no discretion in your mourning, and no understanding: in your laughter—for to me ye seem like, to a weaned babe.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:19
verses.text: One hour weeping and wailing, and after a little: both jesting and wantonness, as of children.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:21
verses.text: For ye are unable to become, perfect men: that weep not yea and laugh not, as the discreet.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:23
verses.text: Touching your books we are grieved, that they have toiled over them: who should read them unto you, even the divine Scriptures.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:25
verses.text: The readers are crying aloud, for ye are deaf: this their crying proves concerning you, that ye are as stocks.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:27
verses.text: For since the reader and the interpreter, are crying aloud: your ears therefore are heavy, or else your hearts.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:29
verses.text: For if there were with you an ear, open to persuasion: it were meet to hear little, and to do much.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:31
verses.text: But because its hearing is closed, whoso knocks at it: the voice returns back to him, who sent it forth.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:33
verses.text: There is no crying with me of mine, I am not deaf: none that reads or interprets for me, I am not dull.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:35
verses.text: The breath that is from Him commands me, sons the God of truth: and with the command there follows, also the fulfilment.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:37
verses.text: With me is no holding back, no turnings aside: I wot no arrow even, could outstrip me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:39
verses.text: But your voices are scorned by me, when ye are weeping: over the graves of your departed, in the cutting off of hope.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:41
verses.text: Were it possible or permitted, when ye are weeping: I would go forth and tell you, to your faces.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:43
verses.text: "I am endeavouring to give, an account of the death: and your voices disturb me, that I err in my count".

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:45
verses.text: Ye nations, let not your understanding, become childish: like that nation whose intelligence, was never great.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:47
verses.text: In which prudence bestows not itself, as in a fool: for its thoughts are darkness, without discernment.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:49
verses.text: For your infants and your sons, in the resurrection: they shall be foremost to come forth, as the first fruits—25.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:50
verses.text: Then after them shall come the just, as victorious: last shall come forth the sinner, as put to shame.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:52
verses.text: For although in the twinkling of an eye, they be quickened: yet is it in order that their ranks, come forth from Sheol.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:54
verses.text: Prophets come forth and Apostles, and holy Fathers: following them in due array, according to command.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:56
verses.text: Lo! that which now is sown, in random mixture: is yielded back in great order, as garden-herbs.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:58
verses.text: For though one in the sowing, should mix all seeds: that which is earlier than its fellow, prevents its fellow,—30.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:59
verses.text: And not as their going down was confused, so disordered shall be: their coming up from the earth, for its order is fixed.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:61
verses.text: Lo! I have been against myself, in what I have said: for secret things which ye comprehended not, from me ye have learned.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:63
verses.text: Instead of the tears that profit not, which are at the tomb: pour them forth in your prayer, in the midst of the Church.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 41:65
verses.text: For to the dead there is profit in these, and likewise to the living: weep not with a weeping that afflicts, both dead and living!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:1
verses.text: Hymn LXIII.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:3
verses.text: Who shall weigh the recompense of Abraham? whom I marvelled at when he bound, his only son.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:5
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:6
verses.text: , To thee be glory, Voice that bringest to life the dead in Sheol: and they have come up as preachers, of His Son Who quickens all!—3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:7
verses.text: At that time I came forth in haste, to see the marvel: how that his knife was drawn out, against his beloved.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:9
verses.text: I gathered my manifold memories, from all quarters: and I collected my spirit to marvel, at that illustrious one.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:11
verses.text: How therefore can ye read, that great story? ye have despised the reading of it, in your very ears.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:13
verses.text: The sword of Jephthah rebukes, him that laments: his daughter was to him a mirror of life from the dead.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:15
verses.text: She gave herself for her father, so commend ye: your life to the Father of all, in the hope of your end.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:17
verses.text: In the womb then did ye not make trial, of a mystery of Sheol? yet in Sheol ye had more rest, than in the womb.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:19
verses.text: It is stubborn in you to stand up against, my mighty will: for lo! to succour them I take away, your departed.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:21
verses.text: By the king of Moab who slew, his son with his hands: he is put to shame who laments, for the departed one.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:23
verses.text: He was a profane man, lo! according, to what you read: but ye are doctors and teachers, as ye suppose.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:25
verses.text: He endured, but ye are furious, in your mourning: against the will of the Lord of all, while ye are weeping.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:27
verses.text: I fear however to let pass, the story of Job: through this feeble mouth of mine, for I am unworthy.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:29
verses.text: So in like manner I turn aside, from mention of their bones: though I praise Him who granted, that they should come to me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:31
verses.text: Dishonour not your members, by your sins: for in Sheol the bones are despised, of evildoers.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:33
verses.text: Whenever I see the body of one of the evil: I trample on it and curse, even his memory.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:35
verses.text: But wherever I see a bone, of one of the just; I set it apart and honour it, and do it worship.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:37
verses.text: Ye feeble ones understand not, all my ordinances: with you orders are confused, for ye are blind.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:39
verses.text: It is Moses alone that I know, to have honoured like me: the bones of that Joseph whom I magnify.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:41
verses.text: But Moses did such honour, to one pure body: but I to the body and the bones, of all the righteous.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:43
verses.text: Brightly shine the bones of Prophets, and of Apostles: a lamp to me in darkness, are all the righteous.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 42:45
verses.text: I worship Him Who lightens for me, the darkness of Sheol: the splendour of Moses who was so great, was as the sun to me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 43:1
verses.text: Hymn LXIV.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 43:3
verses.text: O feeble ones, why weep ye, over your dead: who in death are at rest from sorrows and sins?—2.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 43:4
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 43:5
verses.text: , Glory to Him Who endured all, for the sake of all men: yea tasted death for the sake of all, to bring all to life—3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 43:6
verses.text: I reveal unto you, that even Satan, though much content: at your weeping, yet laughs much, at your mourning.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 43:8
verses.text: In mockery he winks at me and nods to me, as a jester: "Come let us laugh at sinners, for lo! they are mad".

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 43:10
verses.text: Truly they have given up remembrance of that fire, which I have hidden for them: and lo! the fools are drunken with weeping, for their departed.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 43:12
verses.text: Instead of weeping as though, without provision: I had plundered and sent forth their dead, lo! they are mad.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 43:14
verses.text: The souls of the evil are to be afflicted, till the judgment day: and these weep over the graves, like to madmen.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 43:16
verses.text: They care not for their own sins, that haply to-morrow: they must go in shame of face, to join their dead.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 43:18
verses.text: And thus shall all be put to shame alike, family by family: in Sheol the wretches shall repent without avail.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 43:20
verses.text: Leave the drunken and the madman, until that day: wherein each shall shake off his wine wherewith he was maddened.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 43:22
verses.text: I will go to gather them, like children: that they may play the wanton and the madman, until they perish.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 43:24
verses.text: Lo! I have revealed to you the mystery, the secret of my comrade: go forth therefore, depart, amend, in repentance.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 43:26
verses.text: Leave me, I too will depart, I will see to my affairs: that with open face I may give my account to my Lord.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 43:28
verses.text: I know that the wind as it blew, has borne away my words: for ye are the same whom I, ofttimes have proved.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 43:30
verses.text: I remember Jeremiah how he, compared boldness: to the Indian who changes not his skin, though it is of freedom.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 43:32
verses.text: For this too belongs to it, even to freedom: that it binds itself by the will, as though by nature.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 43:34
verses.text: For so powerful is the will, in them that are free: that it may be likened to nature, through its workings.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:1
verses.text: Hymn LXV.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:3
verses.text: Man, O Death, despise thou it not, that image of Adam: which like a seed is committed to earth, till the Resurrection.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:5
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:6
verses.text: , To thee be glory Who didst descend and plunge, after Adam: and draw him out from the depths of Sheol, and bring him into Eden!—3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:7
verses.text: Death, I marvel at this seed, and at your words: for lo! after five thousand years, it springs not yet.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:9
verses.text: M.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:10
verses.text: , Its present state passes away, as winter does: and as a handful of corn it comes in the resurrection, to the garner of life.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:12
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:13
verses.text: , That there is vintage-time, lo! I know, but I have not seen: the dead at any time sown, or yet reaped.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:15
verses.text: M.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:16
verses.text: , There is coming a reaping, O Death, that will leave thee bare: and the Watchers shall go forth as reapers, and make thee desolate.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:18
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:19
verses.text: , When did I become husbandman, instead of vine-dresser? who has turned Sheol the wine-press, into a tilled field?—8.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:20
verses.text: M.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:21
verses.text: , Does not the seed then teach thee, which decays and dies: and is cut off from hope, yet from the rain, recovers hope?—9.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:22
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:23
verses.text: , A dream have ye seen ye feeble ones, of life from the dead: for in waking time the resurrection, ye do not see.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:25
verses.text: M.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:26
verses.text: , Thy drowsiness hinders thee, that thou seest not: the multitudes of mysteries which cry aloud, of the resurrection.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:28
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:29
verses.text: , I know that seeds come to life, but I have not seen: bones that grew in Sheol, and sprang and came up.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:31
verses.text: M.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:32
verses.text: , All thy discourse is like thyself, for lo! Ezekiel: has taught thee how in the valley, the dead come to life.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:34
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:35
verses.text: , Trees have I seen how in summer, they put on their garments: but bones in their nakedness, are cast into Sheol.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:37
verses.text: M.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:38
verses.text: , Moses broke by his splendour, thy heart, O Death: the son of Adam has regained and put on, the glory of Adam.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:40
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:41
verses.text: , Our law in Sheol is this, to keep silence: for you are words and for me deeds, O feeble ones.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:43
verses.text: M.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:44
verses.text: , How are the aged passed over if thou be vinedresser? He Who hindered thee from taking their lives, the same quickens all.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:46
verses.text: The babe in the womb confutes thee, which is as buried there: to me it proclaims life from the dead, but to thee despoiling.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:48
verses.text: The despised flower despises thee, for it is shut up and passed over: yet though lost it is not lost, but blossoms again.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:50
verses.text: The chick cries out from the egg, wherein it is buried: and the graves are rent by a Voice, and the body arises.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:52
verses.text: For a body too is the chick, that is in the egg: lo! its body to our body proclaims, the life from the dead.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:54
verses.text: With the locust thy plea is overthrown, and ended, O Death: for in coming forth from the dust it teaches, the life from the dead.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:56
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:57
verses.text: , I had been content if already, the resurrection had been: for the day of resurrection had disturbed me less, than your judgments.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:59
verses.text: Merciful is the Son of the Highest, yea good and just: and will not harshly avenge on me, the death of Adam.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 44:61
verses.text: Have ye then no understanding, to perceive this: that your father laid on you, this retribution?.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:1
verses.text: Hymn LXVI.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:3
verses.text: Hold your peace, O mortals (said Death), a little while: and be like me who am so silent, in the midst of Sheol.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:5
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:6
verses.text: , To Thee be glory, Watcher, that didst come down, after them that slept: and utter the voice from the Tree, and waken them!—3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:7
verses.text: Ye are grieving, yea, weeping, for him that has gone: as though he came to grind for me, the mill in Sheol.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:9
verses.text: Great is the peace I give, unto the wearied: I wax not weary as you, nor weary them.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:11
verses.text: I hear all manner of curses, from thankless men: the sons of Adam are like Adam, who was thankless to his Lord.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:13
verses.text: Contrary one to the other are your voices, and your doings: with your voices ye weep and in your doings, ye fight daily.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:15
verses.text: I heard weeping and I thought to myself, that none labours: I saw toiling and I thought to myself, that no man dies.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:17
verses.text: The struggles of man made me think, that he is not mortal: his great weeping made me think, that to-morrow he is not.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:19
verses.text: Hear and let me be your counsellor, if ye be willing: for these two, these burdens, are very bitter.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:21
verses.text: Cease a little while from this toil, and from this weeping: toil ye and weep as mortals, who to-morrow vanish.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:23
verses.text: Ye are frantic with weeping, for your departed: and ye struggle in toiling, for your possessions.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:25
verses.text: It is well with the infants that die, and blessed are they: for they are freed from the misery, whereunto ye are cast.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:27
verses.text: Suffer me to go to Sheol, and there to say: "Happy are ye silent dead, how tranquil are ye!"—14.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:28
verses.text: Hear the conclusion of our own words, If there be a resurrection: weep not ye, neither labour as though strangers.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:30
verses.text: Ye straggle as one who was to live, here forever: and ye weep as one who never, should rise again.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:32
verses.text: Hear my words, if there be with you place for hearing: and prepare you provision that when I call ye may answer.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:34
verses.text: For I hearken even I, to Him that calls me: and will restore your bodies, with your treasures.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:36
verses.text: Let there be peace between us, until that day: and when ye come forth I will cry and say, "Depart in peace!"—19.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:37
verses.text: Come ye, you and I even now, shall give glory: to Him that brings to death and to life, that He may give aid.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:39
verses.text: Praise from us all be to thee, O Lord, the living Sacrifice! Who by the sacrifice of Thy Body hast given life to quick and dead.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 45:41
verses.text: Praise to Him Who clothed Himself in our body, and died and rose again: He died in us and we live in Him, blessed be He Who sent Him!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:1
verses.text: Hymn LXVII.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:3
verses.text: Come ye, let us hear how Death convicts the People: that harsher than Death was their sword, against the just.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:5
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:6
verses.text: , To Thee be glory, Who by Thy sacrifice, hast redeemed our disgrace: and Whose death was instead of all deaths, that Thou mightst raise all!—3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:7
verses.text: It was not Death indeed that crucified Jesus, but it was the People: how hateful then the People, that are yet more hateful than I!—4.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:8
verses.text: Into the pit they cast Jeremiah, the miry pit: but I in Sheol allotted, honour to his bones.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:10
verses.text: Naboth they bruised to death with stones, as though he were a dog: how good am I who have never stoned, even a dog!—6.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:11
verses.text: The Hebrew women in famine, ate their children: Sheol is good who delivers and gives them up, without difficulty.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:13
verses.text: To the widow I gave her son, by the hand of Elijah: to the Shunamite her beloved, by the hand of Elisha.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:15
verses.text: The Hebrew women in greed, ate their children: Sheol gave up the dead and learned, to fast soberly.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:17
verses.text: Sheol was not indeed Sheol, but its semblance: Jezebel was the true Sheol, who devoured the just.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:19
verses.text: The sons of the prophets and the prophets, she slew and cast down: to heaven Elijah escaped, from her fury.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:21
verses.text: How many deaths instead of one Death, were among the People! and how many Sheols instead of one, were there also!—12.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:22
verses.text: Samaria and Jezrael her daughters, in Israel: and Zion and Jerusalem her sister, in Judea.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:24
verses.text: Prophets and just men in Judea, and in Israel: in these two abysses, they were drowned.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:26
verses.text: Why then is Sheol hated, and she alone: though there be many that are hateful, rather than she?—15.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:27
verses.text: The dead of the men of Judah, to me are right hateful: yea, abhorred by me are their bones, in the midst of Sheol.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:29
verses.text: Would that then I had a way to cast them out: to cast their bones thence from Sheol, for they cause her to rot.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:31
verses.text: I wonder at the Holy Spirit, that He thus dwelt: in the midst of a People whose savour stank, as their conversation.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:33
verses.text: Onions and garlic are the heralds of their doings: as is the food so is the understanding, of this defiled people.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:35
verses.text: Through the supplication of all that bow, and worship Thy Father: have mercy on Thy worshipper, who is thankless for Thy love.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:37
verses.text: From Hebrews and Aramaeans, and also from the Watchers: to Thee be praise and through Thee to Thy Father, be also glory!—21.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 46:38
verses.text: For that I have a mouth to Death, who is without mouth: may the Son Who is all mouths, hold back my offence from His Father!.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:1
verses.text: Hymn LXVIII.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:3
verses.text: Man.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:4
verses.text: , O, Death, be not thou boastful, over the just: the sons of thy Lord who at His command, come to dwell with thee.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:6
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:7
verses.text: , To thee be glory that by Thy command, Death has reigned: and by Thy Resurrection has been humbled to low estate!—3.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:8
verses.text: Death.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:9
verses.text: , Herein am I exceeding great, according to thy saying: that though I be bond-man I trample on them that are free.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:11
verses.text: M.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:12
verses.text: , Adam was chosen and ruler, and under his yoke: thou, Death, and the Evil One, thy fellow, became bondmen.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:14
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:15
verses.text: , This is our pride that lo! the slaves have become lords: Death, and Satan, his fellow, have trampled on Adam.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:17
verses.text: M.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:18
verses.text: , Lo! the humbling of thee and thy fellow, accurst servants! how Enoch trampled on you both, and rose aloft and reigned.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:20
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:21
verses.text: , If so be Enoch made me grieve, yet have I comfort for on Noah's dust in Sheol, lo! I trample.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:23
verses.text: M.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:24
verses.text: , Tremble, O Death, before man, for though a servant, the yoke of his dominion reigns on all creatures.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:26
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:27
verses.text: , I rejoice then that they are no mean foes that I have overcome: for according to the greatness of the vanquished, he is great that overcomes.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:29
verses.text: M.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:30
verses.text: , Well does thy voice sing triumph, O Death, over the just: for Enoch and Elijah have broken thy pair of wings.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:32
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:33
verses.text: , I know how to weigh my sorrows with my comforts: in place of two, lo! many are come and coming.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:35
verses.text: M.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:36
verses.text: , All that are come and coming to thee dwell as sojourners, and depart from thy abode as Lazarus.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:38
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:39
verses.text: , This thy saying hurts me not, rather it heals me: for Lazarus who rebelled against me, I again subdued.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:41
verses.text: M.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:42
verses.text: , Make answer, O Death, and argue what constrained him, to be raised unless it were a mystery, showing forth his resurrection.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:44
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:45
verses.text: , Ye are famous in arguing as idle ones, while I labour in my task to discern and perform—16.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:46
verses.text: M.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:47
verses.text: , Thou wast well prepared for argument, what has checked thee? The truth of our resurrection has constrained thee by its reputations.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:49
verses.text: D.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:50
verses.text: , Ye have made me hated by you, though I be not hateful: I am he that gives rest to your aged, and your afflicted.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:52
verses.text: Ye have made me as one that troubles, O ye mortals: Adam brought death upon you, and I bear the blame.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:54
verses.text: Gently will I expose you, for I am a slave, and ye are they that by your sins have made me king.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:56
verses.text: The will of Adam roused me for I was at rest: I was dead and ye quickened me, that ye might die by me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:58
verses.text: I accuse the lying ones, who slew and denied it: for Adam slew himself and charges me.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:60
verses.text: The beginning of strife was the accursed serpent which has rightly been crippled: which crept, entered, and set enmity between me and you.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:62
verses.text: Satan is passed by and it is against me that ye are roused: go, strive with the Evil One who made you transgress.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:64
verses.text: He is my comrade and I deny it not, but though he be much hated, what need that I be blamed for him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:65
verses.text: I deny him henceforth.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:67
verses.text: Hearken to my words, O mortals, and I will console you: I have afflicted you and I confess the life from the dead.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:69
verses.text: For there begins to steal into my ears a voice of preparation: of the trumpet that holds itself ready to sound.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:71
verses.text: Hear my words and put much oil into your lamps: for hindrance from my part there is none for you.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:73
verses.text: Yet, Know ye that even although I have said these things, dear is the sound of your voice in the solitude of Sheol.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:75
verses.text: For man has been weighed by me, and great is his peace: for snakes and fishes and birds come to meet him.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:77
verses.text: But it is a marvel that to the Watchers, too, his converse is dear: yea, the Evil One in Gehenna, desires his presence.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:79
verses.text: Ye shall have life from the dead, O ye mortals, and I who am bereft shall be bereft in the midst of Sheol.

verses.name: Nisibene Hymns 47:81
verses.text: Let praise ascend from all to Thee Who quickenest all, and from every quarter gatherest the dust of Adam!.
